Awakened Ball Python.description:
This nonvenomous snake's name comes from its tendency to curl into a ball when frightened, though most people know it for its hunting tactic of coiling around prey and crushing victims with its powerful muscles. Nonetheless, brave herpetologists sometimes keep ball pythons as pets.

Snakes come in an array of forms, from jungle-dwelling constrictors that wrap around their prey to venomous vipers with deadly bites. Regardless, all snakes consume their prey whole by unhinging their jaws and using powerful muscles to move the food down their throats and into their stomachs.

NeJvQpMPGMIfzdCG.description:
Trigger A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the ball python attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

Effect The DC of the Escape check is increased by 2.
NeJvQpMPGMIfzdCG.name: Tighten Coils

l6OEi0DzuPlz6OeT.description:

Effect The ball python moves the creature into its coils, freeing its jaws to make attacks, then uses Constrict against the creature. The ball python's coils can hold one creature.
l6OEi0DzuPlz6OeT.name: Wrap in Coils

Awakened Ball Python.name: Awakened Ball Python

Awakened Giant Chameleon.description: Giant chameleons are legendary for their ability to change their skin color in response to their surroundings. Their eyes are capable of peering in different directions independently, making them almost as difficult to sneak up on as they are to notice in the first place.

qbn93YsujSFI6TMZ.description: The giant chameleon can change its coloration to match its surroundings. It doesn't need cover to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} with a Stealth check.
qbn93YsujSFI6TMZ.name: Camouflage

sguXTwhSIa1swJ1p.description: If the giant chameleon hits a creature with a tongue Strike, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the giant chameleon. The target isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the giant chameleon's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with an attack that hits AC 15 and deals at least 4 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the giant chameleon, it prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.
sguXTwhSIa1swJ1p.name: Tongue Grab

Awakened Giant Chameleon.name: Awakened Giant Chameleon

Awakened Giant Frilled Lizard.description:
Found in warm and tropical forests and savannas, these immense lizards are a deadly threat to the unsuspecting traveler. When they aren't sleeping or stalking prey, giant frilled lizards bask in the sunlight for hours at a time. Explorers sometimes mistakenly think them related to dragons due to their large size, elaborate neck frills (which, when displayed in a show of aggression and dominance, can be mistaken for wings), and ferocious hissing vocalizations used to frighten away creatures too large to eat.

A giant frilled lizard's primary food sources are oversized arthropods and other invertebrates, but it won't hesitate to augment its diet with vertebrates, including other lizards, monkeys, and just about anything it can fit into its mouth-even humanoids. Although capable of short bursts of speed, a giant frilled lizard normally lies perfectly still while hunting, hoping to ambush its prey.

Lizards have a wide range of appearances and abilities, but most share a basic reptilian shape-long tails, wide toothy mouths, and four legs. While a few species are capable of movement on two legs for short periods of time, most are strictly quadrupedal. The three species presented here represent the most common and well-known of the larger species.

ONIHyZ3rL5vCjJod.description:
The giant frilled lizard Strides. If it ends that Stride adjacent to at least one other creature, it suddenly displays its colorful neck frills and issues a frightening hiss. Each adjacent creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure).

The creature is then temporarily immune to Intimidating Display for 1 minute.
ONIHyZ3rL5vCjJod.name: Intimidating Display

Awakened Giant Frilled Lizard.name: Awakened Giant Frilled Lizard

Awakened Megalania.description: Megalanias, like their smaller cousins the giant monitor lizards, strike fast and use their powerful bite to grip their prey. They prefer to swallow their prey whole rather than risk others getting a bite of a hard-won meal.

WVeigExOTiEOwNqA.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).
WVeigExOTiEOwNqA.name: Detect Magic

X2ETPDHTdN8pzX3c.description:
Your eyes glow as you sense aligned auras. Choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful. You detect auras of that alignment. You receive no information beyond presence or absence. You can choose not to detect creatures or effects you're aware have that alignment.

Only creatures of 6th level or higher-unless divine spellcasters, undead, or beings from the Outer Sphere-have alignment auras.

Heightened (2nd) You learn each aura's location and strength.
X2ETPDHTdN8pzX3c.name: Detect Alignment (At Will) (Good Only)

aWo3QXZfBz6gQS6V.description:
Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.
aWo3QXZfBz6gQS6V.name: Invisibility (At Will) (Self Only)

0PTQXw64hVhk83Bm.description: You can ask questions of and receive answers from plants, but the spell doesn't make them more friendly or intelligent than normal. Most normal plants have a distinctive view of the world around them, so they don't recognize details about creatures or know anything about the world beyond their immediate vicinity. Cunning plant monsters are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.
0PTQXw64hVhk83Bm.name: Speak with Plants (Fungi Only)

HTIrnZpmVBuj0HWR.description: When a blighted fungus leshy dies, a burst of rotted compost explodes from its body, dealing @Damage[3d6[slashing]] damage and @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. This area then fills with blighted fungi, becoming difficult terrain until the fungi wither 24 hours later.
HTIrnZpmVBuj0HWR.name: Blightburst

K99lsPqYrIksz3FZ.description:
The blighted fungus leshy transforms into a Small, sickly-looking giant mushroom or patch of fungi. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
K99lsPqYrIksz3FZ.name: Change Shape

Oid3aElVxaYtEI0E.description: A creature damaged by a blighted fungus leshy's spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability.
Oid3aElVxaYtEI0E.name: Spores

dKyKONN7fxhtL3JY.description: A blighted fungus leshy can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of non-fungi creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:15]. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or take @Damage[2[persistent,poison]] damage. On a failure, a creature has its vision range reduced to 20 feet (10 feet on a critical failure) as long as the persistent damage continues.
dKyKONN7fxhtL3JY.name: Spore Cloud

Kd0WbBjbLnB9LgHa.description:
When a blighted leaf leshy hits with its seedpod Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
Kd0WbBjbLnB9LgHa.name: Sickening Blow

YwSiVQSxOJRFAjSF.description:
The blighted leaf leshy transforms into a Small gnarled, rotted tree. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
YwSiVQSxOJRFAjSF.name: Change Shape

cMGzubx06UkoCHhs.description: When a blighted leaf leshy dies, a burst of rotted compost explodes from its body, dealing @Damage[1d6[slashing],1d6[poison]]{1d6 slashing damage and 1d6 poison damage} to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. This area then fills with blighted saplings, becoming difficult terrain until the saplings wither 24 hours later.
cMGzubx06UkoCHhs.name: Blightburst

eBqd0D66QZXIv9iv.description: You can ask questions of and receive answers from plants, but the spell doesn't make them more friendly or intelligent than normal. Most normal plants have a distinctive view of the world around them, so they don't recognize details about creatures or know anything about the world beyond their immediate vicinity. Cunning plant monsters are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.
eBqd0D66QZXIv9iv.name: Speak with Plants (Trees Only)

69MZMQoPzOTaa0gd.description: The shark Swims up to its swim Speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 15 feet high, making a Strike against a creature at any point during the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 20 feet of the water's surface). After the Strike, the shark splashes back down into the water.
69MZMQoPzOTaa0gd.name: Breach

UTQLyZ7H8eYOM5p5.description: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.
UTQLyZ7H8eYOM5p5.name: Blood Scent

udwDeWvmYlXlPUV3.description:
Requirements The shark hit with a jaws Strike on its most recent action this turn.

Effect The creature the shark hit takes @Damage[1d10[slashing]] damage
udwDeWvmYlXlPUV3.name: Savage

Bloody Vortex (3-4).hazardDisable: Slay Silaqui, or @Check[thievery|dc:17|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to pry the gem out of Silaqui followed by disrupting the gem's power by either breaking it (AC 15, Hardness 5, HP 25, BT 13) or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd level; counteract DC 15)
Bloody Vortex (3-4).hazardRoutine:
All creatures within 40 feet of the vortex except Silaqui are drawn toward it. They must attempt either a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save or an @Check[athletics|dc:14|traits:action:swim] check to Swim with a DC of 14, with the following results.

Success The creature is not moved.

Failure The creature is moved 10 feet closer to the center of the vortex. If this causes the creature to reach the center square of the vortex, they are exposed to Consuming Maelstrom.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature is moved 20 feet closer to the center of the vortex.
Bloody Vortex (3-4).name: Bloody Vortex (3-4)

Bloody Vortex (5-6).description: A bloody vortex violently draining into a crack of raw elemental energy, fueled by the curse of a sea devil oracle.
Bloody Vortex (5-6).hazardDisable: Slay Silaqui, or @Check[thievery|dc:20|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to pry the gem out of Silaqui followed by disrupting the gem's power by either breaking it (AC 18, Hardness 10, HP 45, BT 23) or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd level; counteract DC 19)
Bloody Vortex (5-6).hazardRoutine:
All creatures within 40 feet of the vortex except Silaqui are drawn toward it. They must attempt either a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or an @Check[athletics|dc:17|traits:action:swim] check to Swim with a DC of 17, with the following results.

Success The creature is not moved.

Failure The creature is moved 10 feet closer to the center of the vortex. If this causes the creature to reach the center square of the vortex, they are exposed to Consuming Maelstrom.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature is moved 20 feet closer to the center of the vortex.
Bloody Vortex (5-6).name: Bloody Vortex (5-6)

9104lsyfyht93ak0.description:
Trigger The ravener husk takes bludgeoning damage

Effect The ravener's brittle bones shatter, spraying bone shards everywhere. Every creature within a @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10-foot emanation} of the ravener husk takes @Damage[6d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic] save).
9104lsyfyht93ak0.name: Boneshatter

Peb58MTthihyfmEa.description: A ravener senses the spiritual essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. Creatures whose material bodies are one unit with their souls, like celestials and fiends, appear brighter to this sense.
Peb58MTthihyfmEa.name: Soulsense 60 feet

wvec977sf9tk4uj0.description:
The ravener husk breathes a torrent of void energy that deals @Damage[12d6[void]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:40]{40-foot cone} (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save).

They can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.
wvec977sf9tk4uj0.name: Breath Weapon

Brittle Skeletal Horse.description:
Skeletal horses are sometimes used as mounts by other undead or monsters.

Made from bones held together by foul necromancy, skeletons are among the most common types of undead, found haunting old dungeons and forgotten cemeteries.

1AzFNDZFiaJxTAJf.description: Undead and creatures allied with them can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Command} a skeletal steed without needing to attempt a skill check.
1AzFNDZFiaJxTAJf.name: Undead Steed

ohwAZH20CeE3uGMp.description: The horse Strides twice, with its Speed increased by 10 feet.
ohwAZH20CeE3uGMp.name: Gallop

Brittle Skeletal Horse.name: Brittle Skeletal Horse

7Dwwk4c4cBxweZKc.description: A mandragora can smell creatures with blood as an imprecise sense at a range of 30 feet, and it can smell demons, fey, and sorcerers with blood as a precise sense at a range of 30 feet.
7Dwwk4c4cBxweZKc.name: Blood Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet

IOvxdhkIi0W0wzzB.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The mandragora emits an unsettling shriek. Each non-mandragora creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. As long as the creature remains sickened, this slowed condition value can't be reduced below 1.
IOvxdhkIi0W0wzzB.name: Piercing Shriek

Xlbal6st53Tv5z83.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage and stupefied 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage and stupefied 1 (1 round)
Xlbal6st53Tv5z83.name: Bruorsivi Sap Infusion

eTTWHexqpmKAYC0k.description:
Requirements The mandragora has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The mandragora drains blood from the creature it has grabbed, dealing [[/r {2d6}]]{2d6 damage}. If the creature is a demon, fey, or sorcerer, the mandragora gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt.

A creature that has its blood drained by a mandragora is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.
eTTWHexqpmKAYC0k.name: Blood Drain

GHUyWzx0e2bkkF12.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.
GHUyWzx0e2bkkF12.name: Breastplate

KqwornWAWKIeKn5w.description:
You create an illusory visual image of a stationary object. The entire image must fit within the spell's area. The object appears to animate naturally, but it doesn't make sounds or generate smells. For example, water would appear to pour down an illusory waterfall, but it would be silent.

Any creature that touches the image or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

Heightened (2nd) Your image makes appropriate sounds, generates normal smells, and feels right to the touch. The spell gains the auditory trait. The duration increases to 1 hour.

Heightened (5th) As the 2nd-rank version, but the duration is unlimited.
KqwornWAWKIeKn5w.name: Illusory Object

SfXiHRDaxaqXEuig.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).
SfXiHRDaxaqXEuig.name: Detect Magic (Constant)

aFBLWbZSpOnYygCn.description:
Requirements The burned-out efreeti has one hand free

Effect The burned-out efreeti makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If the Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the efreeti's free hand.
aFBLWbZSpOnYygCn.name: Combat Grab

toA1G1C9IA05uuPQ.description: You and your allies traverse the barriers between planes of existence. The targets move to another plane, such as the Plane of Fire, the Netherworld, or the Outer Rifts. You must have specific knowledge of the destination plane and use a magic tuning fork created from material from that plane as a focus for the spell. While the tuning forks for most prominent planes are uncommon, just like the spell plane shift, more obscure planes and demiplanes often have rare tuning forks. The spell is highly imprecise, and you appear 1d20x25 miles from the last place one of the targets (of your choice) was located the last time that target traveled to the plane. If it's the first time traveling to a particular plane for all targets, you appear at a random location on the plane. Plane shift doesn't provide a means of return travel, though casting plane shift again allows you to return to your previous plane unless there are extenuating circumstances.
toA1G1C9IA05uuPQ.name: Plane Shift (At Will) (to Astral Plane, Elemental Planes, or Material Plane only)

uwN4vfr3npnwlu1S.description: When the burned-out efreeti Grabs a creature, that creature takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage, then takes 1d6 fire damage at the end of each of its turns as long as it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.
uwN4vfr3npnwlu1S.name: Burning Grasp

yjV0U0n5eWQGcwsF.description:
Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.
yjV0U0n5eWQGcwsF.name: Invisibility

Chaotic Door (1-2).description: The frame splinters as the door flings open, the force hitting those nearby.
Chaotic Door (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:17|name:Hold the Door Shut|traits:chaotic,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to hold the door shut against the force, or @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Relieve Door Pressure|traits:chaotic,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to deftly relieve pressure from the door.
Chaotic Door (1-2).name: Chaotic Door (1-2)

Chaotic Door (3-4).description: The frame splinters as the door flings open, the force hitting those nearby.
Chaotic Door (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Hold the Door Shut|traits:chaotic,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to hold the door shut against the force, or @Check[thievery|dc:21|name:Relieve Door Pressure|traits:chaotic,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to deftly relieve pressure from the door.
Chaotic Door (3-4).name: Chaotic Door (3-4)

5GAwFJvEq6KExgHC.description:
Trigger A creature that the giant crab can see targets the crab with an attack

Effect The giant crab scuttles to the side and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. After the attack resolves, the crab can Stride up to its speed in a straight line as part of the reaction.
5GAwFJvEq6KExgHC.name: Scuttle

6kfuZGeG5GJHb5wP.description: If a creature critically succeeds at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the giant crab, the crab is flipped over onto its back in addition to the usual effects. A giant crab flipped onto its back has a particularly hard time defending itself; instead of taking the normal -2 circumstance penalty to AC for being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, it takes a -4 circumstance penalty to AC.
6kfuZGeG5GJHb5wP.name: Vulnerable to Prone

1cowjT2wKBPizlNM.description:
Three illusory images of you swirl about your space, potentially causing those who attack you to hit one of the images instead of you. Any attack that would hit you has a random chance of hitting one of your images instead of you. If all three images remain, there is a 1 in 4 chance of hitting you (1 on [[/r 1d4]]). With two images remaining, there is a 1 in 3 chance of hitting you (1-2 on [[/r 1d6]]). With only one image, the chances are 1 in 2 (1-3 on [[/r 1d6]]).

Once an image is hit, it is destroyed. If an attack roll fails to hit your AC but doesn't critically fail, it destroys an image but has no additional effect (even if the attack would normally have an effect on a failure). If an attack roll is a critical success and would hit one of the images, one of the images is destroyed and the attack roll becomes a success against you. Once all the images are destroyed, the spell ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.0PO5mFRhh9HxGAtv]{Spell Effect: Mirror Image}
1cowjT2wKBPizlNM.name: Mirror Image (Wand)

5nzzggF8gZxAFhvP.description:
You channel vitality energy to heal the living or damage the undead. If the target is a willing living creature, you restore 1d8 Hit Points. If the target is undead, you deal that amount of vitality damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing a living creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8

3 (material, somatic, verbal) You disperse vitality energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the burst.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.
5nzzggF8gZxAFhvP.name: Heal

9hLHCO5FVWgbbD1P.description:
A roaring blast of fire detonates at a spot you designate, dealing 6d6 fire damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.
9hLHCO5FVWgbbD1P.name: Fireball (Deals Cold Damage)

EFJbwURtmwbvaitP.description: Chesjilawa can see normally through mist, fog, and all forms of precipitation. She ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition caused by such effects. She ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from snow and ice and doesn't risk falling when crossing such terrain.
EFJbwURtmwbvaitP.name: Winter Wise

HcnRFHeoFQphRmRs.description: A mirror of ice forms around Chesjilawa's hand or wand as she focuses her magic into a more physical form, the better to damage creatures who can resist the cold. If her next action is to Cast a Spell that deals cold damage, the mirror shatters into a blitz of ice shards, changing half of the spell's damage from cold to slashing.
HcnRFHeoFQphRmRs.name: Mirrorshard Spell

NDbJiRieRoOmUrXV.description:
You summon an isolated blizzard of obscuring, scouring ice to follow your target. The target attempts a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes @Damage[1d6[cold]] damage, and the spell ends.

Failure The target takes @Damage[1d6[cold]] damage and @Damage[1d6[persistent,cold]] damage. (The persistent damage automatically ends when the spell ends.) It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to other creatures, and other creatures are concealed to it.

Critical Failure As failure, but both the cold damage and the persistent cold damage increase to @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage and @Damage[2d6[persistent,cold]] damage.

Heightened (+1) The cold damage and persistent cold damage increase by 1 (2 on a critical failure).
NDbJiRieRoOmUrXV.name: Personal Blizzard

RUocrBLlgb3rLfCe.description:
In your mind's eye, you see a path northward. You immediately know which direction is north (if it exists at your current location).

Heightened (7th) You can instead know the direction to a familiar location, such as a previous home or a favorite tavern.
RUocrBLlgb3rLfCe.name: Know Direction

S6mS8emZbzRo8WV3.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.j8vIoIEWElvpwkcI]{Mirror Image}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.
S6mS8emZbzRo8WV3.name: Wand of Mirror Image (Level 2)

SWG29bYwatFZdTPS.description:
Creatures in the area are outlined by glittering dust. Each creature must attempt a Reflex save. If a creature has its invisibility negated by this spell, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} instead of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This applies both if the creature was already Invisible and if it benefits from new invisibility effects before the end of the invisibility negation effect from this spell.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's invisibility is negated for 2 rounds.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 minute and its invisibility is negated for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round and Dazzled for 10 minutes. Its invisibility is negated for 10 minutes.
SWG29bYwatFZdTPS.name: Glitterdust

Ysa4ATmXLaT9VVyD.description:
A cone of icy shards bursts from your spread hands and coats the target in a layer of frost. You deal 2d4 cold damage to creatures in the area; they must each attempt a Reflex save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 2 rounds.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 2 rounds.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d4.
Ysa4ATmXLaT9VVyD.name: Chilling Spray

fgakUMKQBPR6HkMc.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.
fgakUMKQBPR6HkMc.name: Stone Knife

i64w2e9G0PytAjR5.description:
Icy flowers bloom around Chesjilawa as she instantly transports herself in a flurry of snow to a space within 120 feet that she can see. The destination must contain ice or snow.

She then can't Snow Step for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
i64w2e9G0PytAjR5.name: Snow Step

vJjHIvcQENXSdIRA.description:
A shield of elemental energy protects a creature against one type of energy damage. Choose acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage. The target and its gear gain resistance 5 against the damage type you chose.

Heightened (4th) The resistance increases to 10, and you can target up to two creatures.

Heightened (7th) The resistance increases to 15, and you can target up to five creatures.
vJjHIvcQENXSdIRA.name: Resist Energy

ym0o5AspNj1Mij5j.description:
You conjure grease, with effects based on choosing area or target.

  • Area [4 contiguous 5-foot squares] All solid ground in the area is covered with grease. Each creature standing on the greasy surface must succeed at a Reflex save or an Acrobatics check against your spell DC or fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. Creatures using an action to move onto the greasy surface during the spell's duration must attempt either a Reflex save or an Acrobatics check to Balance. A creature that Steps or Crawls doesn't have to attempt a check or save.
  • Target [1 object of Bulk 1 or less] If you cast the spell on an unattended object, anyone trying to pick up the object must succeed at an Acrobatics check or Reflex save against your spell DC to do so. If you target an attended object, the creature that has the object must attempt an Acrobatics check or Reflex save. On a failure, the holder or wielder takes a -2 circumstance penalty to all checks that involve using the object; on a critical failure, the holder or wielder releases the item. The object lands in an adjacent square of the GM's choice. If you cast this spell on a worn object, the wearer gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves against attempts to grapple them.
ym0o5AspNj1Mij5j.name: Grease

z93pBKN5hkimGhas.description:
Siphoning void energy into yourself, your hand radiates a pale darkness. Your touch weakens the living and disorients undead, possibly even causing them to flee. The effect depends on whether the target is living or undead.

  • Living Creature The spell deals void damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting modifier. The target attempts a basic Fortitude save, but is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round on a critical failure.
  • Undead Creature The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round on a failed Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Will save.

Heightened (+1) The void damage to living creatures increases by 1d4.
z93pBKN5hkimGhas.name: Chill Touch

0QxEUJDERK7Lezr8.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.j8vIoIEWElvpwkcI]{Mirror Image}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.
0QxEUJDERK7Lezr8.name: Wand of Mirror Image (Level 2)

2sPPytpDwbbGGzJk.description:
Icy flowers bloom around Chesjilawa as she instantly transports herself in a flurry of snow to a space within 120 feet that she can see. The destination must contain ice or snow.

She then can't Snow Step for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
2sPPytpDwbbGGzJk.name: Snow Step

6aniwxM8SiOu8BfG.description:
A roaring blast of fire detonates at a spot you designate, dealing 6d6 fire damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.
6aniwxM8SiOu8BfG.name: Fireball (Deals Cold Damage)

7JfnRFYCIDv7qCUK.description:
Three illusory images of you swirl about your space, potentially causing those who attack you to hit one of the images instead of you. Any attack that would hit you has a random chance of hitting one of your images instead of you. If all three images remain, there is a 1 in 4 chance of hitting you (1 on [[/r 1d4]]). With two images remaining, there is a 1 in 3 chance of hitting you (1-2 on [[/r 1d6]]). With only one image, the chances are 1 in 2 (1-3 on [[/r 1d6]]).

Once an image is hit, it is destroyed. If an attack roll fails to hit your AC but doesn't critically fail, it destroys an image but has no additional effect (even if the attack would normally have an effect on a failure). If an attack roll is a critical success and would hit one of the images, one of the images is destroyed and the attack roll becomes a success against you. Once all the images are destroyed, the spell ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.0PO5mFRhh9HxGAtv]{Spell Effect: Mirror Image}
7JfnRFYCIDv7qCUK.name: Mirror Image (Wand)

BlSJVFCSyEIzH32O.description:
A cone of icy shards bursts from your spread hands and coats the target in a layer of frost. You deal 2d4 cold damage to creatures in the area; they must each attempt a Reflex save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 2 rounds.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 2 rounds.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d4.
BlSJVFCSyEIzH32O.name: Chilling Spray

ENj4wTgHv9eTNP5P.description:
In your mind's eye, you see a path northward. You immediately know which direction is north (if it exists at your current location).

Heightened (7th) You can instead know the direction to a familiar location, such as a previous home or a favorite tavern.
ENj4wTgHv9eTNP5P.name: Know Direction

MxwlTxikfGXnrlr3.description: Chesjilawa can see normally through mist, fog, and all forms of precipitation. She ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition caused by such effects. She ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from snow and ice and doesn't risk falling when crossing such terrain.
MxwlTxikfGXnrlr3.name: Winter Wise

NKfe8pSYWp4AzWcN.description:
You conjure grease, with effects based on choosing area or target.

  • Area [4 contiguous 5-foot squares] All solid ground in the area is covered with grease. Each creature standing on the greasy surface must succeed at a Reflex save or an Acrobatics check against your spell DC or fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. Creatures using an action to move onto the greasy surface during the spell's duration must attempt either a Reflex save or an Acrobatics check to Balance. A creature that Steps or Crawls doesn't have to attempt a check or save.
  • Target [1 object of Bulk 1 or less] If you cast the spell on an unattended object, anyone trying to pick up the object must succeed at an Acrobatics check or Reflex save against your spell DC to do so. If you target an attended object, the creature that has the object must attempt an Acrobatics check or Reflex save. On a failure, the holder or wielder takes a -2 circumstance penalty to all checks that involve using the object; on a critical failure, the holder or wielder releases the item. The object lands in an adjacent square of the GM's choice. If you cast this spell on a worn object, the wearer gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves against attempts to grapple them.
NKfe8pSYWp4AzWcN.name: Grease

SEeNrV1YVscRiAEM.description: A mirror of ice forms around Chesjilawa's hand or wand as she focuses her magic into a more physical form, the better to damage creatures who can resist the cold. If her next action is to Cast a Spell that deals cold damage, the mirror shatters into a blitz of ice shards, changing half of the spell's damage from cold to slashing.
SEeNrV1YVscRiAEM.name: Mirrorshard Spell

SVAWx5khnlWyQFtC.description:
Siphoning void energy into yourself, your hand radiates a pale darkness. Your touch weakens the living and disorients undead, possibly even causing them to flee. The effect depends on whether the target is living or undead.

  • Living Creature The spell deals void damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting modifier. The target attempts a basic Fortitude save, but is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round on a critical failure.
  • Undead Creature The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round on a failed Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Will save.

Heightened (+1) The void damage to living creatures increases by 1d4.
SVAWx5khnlWyQFtC.name: Chill Touch

UPkVXe7ahvzRCE22.description:
You create a gray storm cloud that pelts creatures with an icy deluge. When you Cast the Spell, a burst of magical hail deals 2d8 bludgeoning damage and 2d8 cold damage to each creature in the area below the cloud (basic Reflex save). Snow and sleet continue to rain down in the area for the remainder of the spell's duration, making the area difficult terrain. Any creature that ends its turn in the storm takes @Damage[(floor(@item.level/2))[cold]] damage. If you Cast this Spell outdoors, you can create two non-overlapping clouds instead of one. As normal, if a Large or larger creature is in both clouds, it still only takes the initial damage once and the continuing damage once per turn.

Heightened (+2) The initial bludgeoning damage and cold damage increase by 1d8 each, and the cold damage creatures take at the end of their turns increases by 1.
UPkVXe7ahvzRCE22.name: Ice Storm

WPXsRIH4LQYZlS1q.description:
Creatures in the area are outlined by glittering dust. Each creature must attempt a Reflex save. If a creature has its invisibility negated by this spell, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} instead of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This applies both if the creature was already Invisible and if it benefits from new invisibility effects before the end of the invisibility negation effect from this spell.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's invisibility is negated for 2 rounds.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 minute and its invisibility is negated for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round and Dazzled for 10 minutes. Its invisibility is negated for 10 minutes.
WPXsRIH4LQYZlS1q.name: Glitterdust

eEqiLd9oPE50nkEd.description:
A shield of elemental energy protects a creature against one type of energy damage. Choose acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage. The target and its gear gain resistance 5 against the damage type you chose.

Heightened (4th) The resistance increases to 10, and you can target up to two creatures.

Heightened (7th) The resistance increases to 15, and you can target up to five creatures.
eEqiLd9oPE50nkEd.name: Resist Energy

eaPNU4eIO6MHNA5b.description: The target transforms into a vaporous state. In this state, the target is amorphous. It loses any item bonus to AC and all other effects and bonuses from armor, and it uses its proficiency modifier for unarmored defense. It gains resistance 8 to physical damage and is immune to precision damage. It can't cast spells, activate items, or use actions that have the attack or manipulate trait. It gains a fly Speed of 10 feet and can slip through tiny cracks. The target can Dismiss the spell.
eaPNU4eIO6MHNA5b.name: Gaseous Form

iVHAnkLyIlb06sBL.description:
You channel vitality energy to heal the living or damage the undead. If the target is a willing living creature, you restore 1d8 Hit Points. If the target is undead, you deal that amount of vitality damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing a living creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8

3 (material, somatic, verbal) You disperse vitality energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the burst.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.
iVHAnkLyIlb06sBL.name: Heal

sLKRt47FZp0ilDke.description:
You summon an isolated blizzard of obscuring, scouring ice to follow your target. The target attempts a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes @Damage[1d6[cold]] damage, and the spell ends.

Failure The target takes @Damage[1d6[cold]] damage and @Damage[1d6[persistent,cold]] damage. (The persistent damage automatically ends when the spell ends.) It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to other creatures, and other creatures are concealed to it.

Critical Failure As failure, but both the cold damage and the persistent cold damage increase to @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage and @Damage[2d6[persistent,cold]] damage.

Heightened (+1) The cold damage and persistent cold damage increase by 1 (2 on a critical failure).
sLKRt47FZp0ilDke.name: Personal Blizzard

z5E6Jyeu3594f4ac.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.
z5E6Jyeu3594f4ac.name: +1 Striking Stone Knife

Churning Lava (1-2).description: The equilibrium of the brown mold and lava river is disturbed, creating bubbles of molten stone that burst and spew burning debris.
Churning Lava (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[nature|dc:14|name:Clear mold] or @Check[survival|dc:14|name:Clear mold] or @Check[thievery|dc:17|name:Clear mold] to clear your square and all adjacent squares of the mold; the churning lava does not target creatures in cleared squares with its spatter attack, but the hazard is not destroyed until every square has been cleared of mold.
Churning Lava (1-2).hazardReset: If not completely destroyed, the mold spreads to one additional square within 10 feet of lava each day until it fully regenerates and regains its state of equilibrium. If every square is cleaned of mold, the hazard is destroyed.
Churning Lava (1-2).hazardRoutine: (1 action) On the its initiative, the churning lava targets a random creature in the area with a ranged spatter attack as a magma bubble bursts.
Churning Lava (1-2).name: Churning Lava (1-2)

Churning Lava (3-4).description: The equilibrium of the brown mold and lava river is disturbed, creating bubbles of molten stone that burst and spew burning debris.
Churning Lava (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[nature|dc:17|name:Clear mold] or @Check[survival|dc:17|name:Clear mold] or @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Clear mold] to clear your square and all adjacent squares of the mold; the churning lava does not target creatures in cleared squares with its spatter attack, but the hazard is not destroyed until every square has been cleared of mold.
Churning Lava (3-4).hazardReset: If not completely destroyed, the mold spreads to one additional square within 10 feet of lava each day until it fully regenerates and regains its state of equilibrium. If every square is cleaned of mold, the hazard is destroyed.
Churning Lava (3-4).hazardRoutine: (1 action) On the its initiative, the churning lava targets a random creature in the area with a ranged spatter attack as a magma bubble bursts.
Churning Lava (3-4).name: Churning Lava (3-4)

Clouded Quartz (5-6).description:
Insatiable scavengers stalking the eternal gloom of the Darklands, cavern trolls consume all in their path-even rocks and minerals when more nourishing sustenance is scarce. These rocky goliaths can tunnel through stone with their iron-sharp claws.

Cavern trolls rarely venture to the surface world, for they have a debilitating vulnerability to sunlight that petrifies them on sustained contact. Unlike common trolls, cavern trolls can regenerate wounds dealt by fire. The crystalline nature of their skin, however, permits sonic attacks to neutralize their signature regeneration.

As cavern trolls age, their flinty skin becomes studded with small crystals and stones of various composition. Paragons of their kind have toothy maws replete with large, crystalline fangs. A typical cavern troll stands 14 feet in height and weighs about 2,000 pounds.

40gYFH2MsCS36FWP.description: 10 feet. Clouded Quartz is surrounded by a perpetual storm. The whirling winds impose a -2 circumstance penalty on ranged attack rolls using physical ammunition that target her or originate from her.
40gYFH2MsCS36FWP.name: Perpetual Storm Aura

5iCtZwpJXUptAcCh.description:
You ward a creature with protective energy that deters enemy attacks. Creatures attempting to attack the target must attempt a Will save each time. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends.

Critical Success Sanctuary ends.

Success The creature can attempt its attack and any other attacks against the target this turn.

Failure The creature can't attack the target and wastes the action. It can't attempt further attacks against the target this turn.

Critical Failure The creature wastes the action and can't attempt to attack the target for the rest of sanctuary's duration.
5iCtZwpJXUptAcCh.name: Sanctuary

BczEX9fZ2q5qXxKI.description: Clouded Quartz can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. She can leave a tunnel if she desires.
BczEX9fZ2q5qXxKI.name: Rock Tunneler

FqhlwNyFsYxtpGNp.description: Clouded Quartz can see perfectly through wind and water. She never takes penalties to Perception from wind, rain, fog, or other precipitation, or from looking through water or being underwater, and such conditions don't cause anything to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from her.
FqhlwNyFsYxtpGNp.name: Tempest Sight

JVo6QCuZs7cF4Ybw.description:
An arc of lightning leaps from one target to another. You deal electricity damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.
JVo6QCuZs7cF4Ybw.name: Electric Arc

K9MAlAqutwFIw1hM.description:
You shoot an utterly cold ray of darkness tinged with unholy energy. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. You deal 5d6 cold damage, plus 5d6 spirit damage if the target is a celestial.

If the ray passes through an area of magical light or targets a creature affected by magical light, chilling darkness attempts to counteract the light. If you need to determine whether the ray passes through an area of light, draw a line between yourself and the spell's target.

Critical Success The target takes double damage.

Success The target takes full damage.

Heightened (+1) The cold damage increases by 2d6, and the spirit damage against celestials increases by 2d6.
K9MAlAqutwFIw1hM.name: Chilling Darkness

KFX9kDpIv4HdcF0I.description:
Siphoning void energy into yourself, your hand radiates a pale darkness. Your touch weakens the living and disorients undead, possibly even causing them to flee. The effect depends on whether the target is living or undead.

  • Living Creature The spell deals void damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting modifier. The target attempts a basic Fortitude save, but is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round on a critical failure.
  • Undead Creature The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round on a failed Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Will save.

Heightened (+1) The void damage to living creatures increases by 1d4.
KFX9kDpIv4HdcF0I.name: Chill Touch

bEExOBgW7jRxLIQ4.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.
bEExOBgW7jRxLIQ4.name: Shield

bSGtekd8kTYjCWaY.description:
A violent wind issues forth from your palm, blowing from the point where you are when you cast the spell to the line's opposite end. The wind extinguishes small non-magical fires, disperses fog and mist, blows objects of light Bulk or less around, and pushes larger objects. Large or smaller creatures in the area must attempt a Fortitude save. Large or smaller creatures that later move into the gust must attempt the save on entering.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature can't move against the wind.

Failure The creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If it was flying, it suffers the effects of critical failure instead.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed 30 feet in the wind's direction, knocked Prone, and takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage.
bSGtekd8kTYjCWaY.name: Gust of Wind

tuQ8FrXL4iChAQA1.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, Clouded Quartz immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions or Trample. The slowed value increases by 1 each time she ends her turn in sunlight. If Clouded Quartz's actions are reduced to 0 in this way, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} until she spends at least 1 minute in darkness. Spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst} that create magical sunlight cannot petrify Clouded Quartz, but she's slowed 1 for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} after being exposed to such an effect.
tuQ8FrXL4iChAQA1.name: Sunlight Petrification

yjvxk4bSdGUDCKw1.description:
The target makes no sound, preventing creatures from noticing it using hearing or other senses alone. The target can't use sonic attacks, nor can it use actions with the auditory trait. This prevents it from casting spells that include verbal components.

Heightened (4th) The spell effect emanates from the touched creature, silencing all sound in or passing through a 10- foot radius and preventing any auditory and sonic effects in the affected area. While within the radius, creatures are subject to the same effects as the target. Depending upon the position of the effect, a creature might notice the lack of sound reaching it (blocking off the noise coming from a party, for example).
yjvxk4bSdGUDCKw1.name: Silence

Clouded Quartz (5-6).name: Clouded Quartz (5-6)

Clouded Quartz (7-8).description:

As cavern trolls age, their flinty skin becomes studded with small crystals and stones of various composition. Paragons of their kind have toothy maws replete with large, crystalline fangs. A typical cavern troll stands 14 feet in height and weighs about 2,000 pounds.

  • Undead Creature The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round on a failed Fortitude save. V424fCTtutGwvAn3.description:
Extending a finger, you fire a beam of void energy that weakens the life force of any creature it touches. Each living creature in the line must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[(floor(@item.rank/2))d8[persistent,void]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[(floor(@item.rank/2)*2)d8[persistent,void]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[(floor(@item.rank/2)*2)d8[persistent,void]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Heightened (+2) The persistent void damage increases by 1d8 on a success, or by 2d8 on a failure or critical failure.
V424fCTtutGwvAn3.name: Enervation

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature can't move against the wind.

Failure The creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If it was flying, it suffers the effects of critical failure instead.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed 30 feet in the wind's direction, knocked Prone, and takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage.
bSGtekd8kTYjCWaY.name: Gust of Wind

nD2LoTZSJHpg9T7L.description: You repel effects that would hinder a creature or slow its movement. While under this spell's effect, the target ignores effects that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} an effect that has them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, they automatically succeed unless the effect is magical and of a higher level than the freedom of movement spell.
nD2LoTZSJHpg9T7L.name: Freedom of Movement

tuQ8FrXL4iChAQA1.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, Clouded Quartz immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions or Trample. The slowed value increases by 1 each time she ends her turn in sunlight. If Clouded Quartz's actions are reduced to 0 in this way, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} until she spends at least 1 minute in darkness. Spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst} that create magical sunlight cannot petrify Clouded Quartz, but she is slowed 1 for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} after being exposed to such an effect.
tuQ8FrXL4iChAQA1.name: Sunlight Petrification

yjvxk4bSdGUDCKw1.description:
The target makes no sound, preventing creatures from noticing it using hearing or other senses alone. The target can't use sonic attacks, nor can it use actions with the auditory trait. This prevents it from casting spells that include verbal components.

Heightened (4th) The spell effect emanates from the touched creature, silencing all sound in or passing through a 10- foot radius and preventing any auditory and sonic effects in the affected area. While within the radius, creatures are subject to the same effects as the target. Depending upon the position of the effect, a creature might notice the lack of sound reaching it (blocking off the noise coming from a party, for example).
yjvxk4bSdGUDCKw1.name: Silence

Clouded Quartz (7-8).name: Clouded Quartz (7-8)

Cobbleswarm (B5).description:
Cobble mites resemble squarish stones a few inches across with mouths like split geodes. Though indolent and harmless alone, they're dangerous in large groups.

Busy road builders might unknowingly use cobble mites in construction.

MdAaSnMbM5KOAlWl.description: Each foe in the cobbleswarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).
MdAaSnMbM5KOAlWl.name: Pummeling Assault

deXYiHJyBjDSNFF5.description:
The cobbleswarm attempts an @Check[athletics] check and compares the result to the Fortitude DC of each creature in its space. This counts as two attacks for the cobbleswarm's multiple attack penalty.

Critical Success The creature falls prone, takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the cobbleswarm until the end of the cobbleswarm's next turn.

Success The creature falls prone.
deXYiHJyBjDSNFF5.name: Grasping Bites

jmLRUmx1Vp2TnZd6.description: A cobbleswarm's tremorsense is a precise sense out to 40 feet and an imprecise sense out to 80 feet. A cobbleswarm can't sense anything beyond the range of its tremorsense.
jmLRUmx1Vp2TnZd6.name: Tremorsense (Precise) 40 feet, (Imprecise) 80 feet

Cobbleswarm (B5).name: Cobbleswarm (B5)

Collapsing Cabinet (1-2).description:
Fluids from leaking beakers have eaten nearly through the supports holding up this cabinet.

This Broken Threshold for this trap is 5, not 10.
Collapsing Cabinet (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:15|name:Support Cabinet|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) to gently place something under the cabinet to support its weight.
Collapsing Cabinet (1-2).name: Collapsing Cabinet (1-2)

Collapsing Cabinet (3-4).description:
Fluids from leaking beakers have eaten nearly through the supports holding up this cabinet.

This Broken Threshold for this trap is 10, not 20.
Collapsing Cabinet (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Support Cabinet|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) to gently place something under the cabinet to support its weight.
Collapsing Cabinet (3-4).name: Collapsing Cabinet (3-4)

Collapsing Ice.description: The ice here is weak and collapses under the weight of a Small or larger creature.
Collapsing Ice.hazardDisable: 2 @Check[crafting|dc:19|name:Create Ice Brace] to create a makeshift device to brace the ice.
Collapsing Ice.name: Collapsing Ice

Collapsing Ramp (7-8).description: Abyssal fire hits the stone beneath the ramp, causing a 15-foot-long section of it to collapse.
Collapsing Ramp (7-8).hazardDisable: @Check[crafting|dc:28] (expert) to stabilize the masonry. Each attempt takes 2 actions.
Collapsing Ramp (7-8).name: Collapsing Ramp (7-8)

Collapsing Ramp (9-10).description: Abyssal fire hits the stone beneath the ramp, causing a 15-foot-long section of it to collapse.
Collapsing Ramp (9-10).hazardDisable: @Check[crafting|dc:31] (expert) to stabilize the masonry. Each attempt takes 2 actions.
Collapsing Ramp (9-10).name: Collapsing Ramp (9-10)

Commoner (PFS 2-13).description:
Though not every commoner is downtrodden, many live hard lives of toil as they work to keep their families fed and housed in relative comfort. While many commoners are just simple folks who keep to themselves, sometimes commoners rebel, either rising up to face their oppressors or persuaded or even duped into joining nefarious plans and criminal conspiracies. Commoners benefit from power in numbers, and a crowd of commoners can accomplish a great deal more than their rulers often expect.

Unfortunately, every society has people living on its fringes. While good communities work to grant aid and respite to their downtrodden, sometimes-due to economic downturn, famine, or war-the ranks of the less fortunate exceed the community's capacity to support them. In heartless neutral and evil societies, poverty is seen as an inevitability that can never be truly eradicated, or even worse, as a tool to be manipulated for political gain.

T3ZpHsIT64RGyhT0.description: When three or more commoners are adjacent to each other each commoner gets a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, attack rolls, and damage rolls.
T3ZpHsIT64RGyhT0.name: Power of the Mob

Commoner (PFS 2-13).name: Commoner (PFS 2-13)

DdBcbOs69kmUVmkm.description: When the corrupted wildfire successfully strikes a creature with an attack that deals persistent fire damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical hit). This condition cannot be reduced below 1 while the creature is subject to the persistent fire damage from the attack, and ends automatically when the persistent fire ends.
DdBcbOs69kmUVmkm.name: Filthy Burn

K2357WczpsewBpx1.description:
The burning sap that makes up the corrupted wildfire's body sputters and pops, ejecting a cloud of acrid that smoke in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] that lasts for 1 round.

This smoke provides concealment to all creatures within, and deals @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage to any creature that enters or begins its turn in the cloud (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic]).

A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).
K2357WczpsewBpx1.name: Acrid Cloud

llP0iPm4qwoX8UZ6.description: The corrupted wildfire ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.
llP0iPm4qwoX8UZ6.name: Smoke Vision

DdBcbOs69kmUVmkm.description: When the corrupted wildfire successfully strikes a creature with an attack that deals persistent fire damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical hit). This condition cannot be reduced below 1 while the creature is subject to the persistent fire damage from the attack, and ends automatically when the persistent fire ends.
DdBcbOs69kmUVmkm.name: Filthy Burn

K2357WczpsewBpx1.description:
The burning sap that makes up the corrupted wildfire's body sputters and pops, ejecting a cloud of acrid that smoke in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] that lasts for 1 round.

This smoke provides concealment to all creatures within, and deals @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage to any creature that enters or begins its turn in the cloud (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic]).

A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).
K2357WczpsewBpx1.name: Acrid Cloud

llP0iPm4qwoX8UZ6.description: The corrupted wildfire ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.
llP0iPm4qwoX8UZ6.name: Smoke Vision

2luizQlmLffnsx7x.description:
A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]{Telekinetic Hand}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.O9w7r4BKgPogYDDe]{Produce Flame}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TVKNbcgTee19PXZR]{Shield}
2luizQlmLffnsx7x.name: Spellbook

8P35KyyCPduiZMo1.description:
You create a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because you're levitating the object, you can move it in any direction. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

Heightened (3rd) You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (7th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
8P35KyyCPduiZMo1.name: Mage Hand

DlVvYo3sjQ5xRL1y.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).
DlVvYo3sjQ5xRL1y.name: Detect Magic

R9CWp2XMpF8PW99m.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.
R9CWp2XMpF8PW99m.name: Shield

zPvpFOVRVK0Tm89S.description:
Trigger A creature would hit Corvius with an attack roll, or Corvius would fail a saving throw

Frequency one use

Effect The effects of a past wish warp reality in Corvius's favor. If used on a successful attack roll, the attack roll instead critically misses. If used on Corvius's saving throw, Corvius instead critically succeeds at the saving throw.
zPvpFOVRVK0Tm89S.name: I Wish You Hadn't Done That

2luizQlmLffnsx7x.description:
A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]{Telekinetic Hand}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.O9w7r4BKgPogYDDe]{Produce Flame}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TVKNbcgTee19PXZR]{Shield}

After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

rabsv0ujRkLST8Vv.description:

Heightened (3rd) You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (7th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
