Empowered Blood (3-4).hazardReset: The hazard resets at the beginning of each round until it is disabled.
Empowered Blood (3-4).name: Empowered Blood (3-4)

85kxXW17gvaJu9KH.description: When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released. Adjacent creatures take @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:15|basic] save.
85kxXW17gvaJu9KH.name: Explosive Death

Explosive Monolith (3-4).description: A burst of abyssal energy ignites the sap in a nearby bruorsivi, which explodes in a burst of fiery splinters.
Explosive Monolith (3-4).hazardDisable:
@Check[arcana|dc:17], @Check[occultism|dc:17], or @Check[religion|dc:17] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:20] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both).

Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage(@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Explosive Monolith]).
Explosive Monolith (3-4).hazardRoutine:
(1 action) On the hazard's turn, randomly select a PC within 40 feet of the monolith. A tree near that PC explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10], dealing @Damage[1d6[piercing],1d6[fire]]{1d6 piercing damage and 1d6 fire damage}. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|name:Explosive Monolith|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.
Explosive Monolith (3-4).name: Explosive Monolith (3-4)

Explosive Monolith (5-6).description: A burst of abyssal energy ignites the sap in a nearby bruorsivi, which explodes in a burst of fiery splinters.
Explosive Monolith (5-6).hazardDisable:
@Check[arcana|dc:20], @Check[occultism|dc:20], or @Check[religion|dc:20] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:23] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both).

Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Explosive Monolith]).
Explosive Monolith (5-6).hazardRoutine:
(1 action) On the hazard's turn, randomly select a PC within 40 feet of the monolith. A tree near that PC explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10], dealing @Damage[2d6[piercing],2d6[fire]]{2d6 piercing damage and 2d6 fire damage}. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20|name:Explosive Monolith|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.
Explosive Monolith (5-6).name: Explosive Monolith (5-6)

Famished Mimic.description:
Thought to be the result of a failed experiment meant to animate objects or a sinister alghollthu creation, mimics are clever monsters that can take the form of common manufactured objects. Mimics are ambush predators and voracious eaters, surprising their prey through their uncanny ability to mimic the form of common furniture and miscellany. They remain disguised until unsuspecting adventurers happen by, then they lash out in ambush.

Mimics possess complex alien minds, and while often cruel and self-serving, they also enjoy conversation with their prey from time to time. For unknown reasons, they are especially interested in humanoids. Mimics have a strong dislike for others of their kind and tend to live alone. A mimic can remain in its alternate form for an extremely long period of time, sometimes remaining disguised in a dungeon chamber for decades. Regardless of how long it waits, the mimic remains vigilant and alert, ready to strike at any moment.

91iOrkVbzeP7cK2M.description:
The mimic is coated in an adhesive slime. Any creature that hits the mimic, is hit by the mimic, or otherwise touches the mimic must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (Escape DC 21). A weapon that hits the mimic is stuck to the mimic and can be removed with a successful @Check[athletics|dc:23] check (made as a single action).

A mimic can have any number of objects or creatures stuck to it at a time. The mimic can release a stuck creature or object by using a single action, and the adhesive dissolves 1 minute after the mimic dies, releasing all stuck objects and creatures.
91iOrkVbzeP7cK2M.name: Adhesive

M3QwWIU2rzRHWndo.description: The mimic assumes the shape of any Medium object. This doesn't change the mimic's texture or overall size but can alter its coloration and visual appearance. It has an automatic result of 26 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as the object that it's mimicking.
M3QwWIU2rzRHWndo.name: Mimic Object

Ns2pok7e6UtuKUd6.description:
Trigger A creature touches or physically interacts with the mimic while the mimic is transformed using Mimic Object.

Effect The triggering creature is automatically stuck by the mimic's adhesive (it receives no save). The mimic then makes a pseudopod Strike against any creature adjacent to the mimic.

Object Lesson can't be used again until the mimic escapes and takes on a new disguise.
Ns2pok7e6UtuKUd6.name: Object Lesson

qGVF829Lwi4ZemA9.name: Dwelling Lore (applies only to the dungeon it lives in)

Famished Mimic.name: Famished Mimic

Fence (PFS 2-00).description:
The longer criminals hold on to stolen loot, the greater the chance they will get caught. Fences make themselves indispensable in the underworld by paying for stolen goods in order to resell them later, whether through a seemingly legitimate business or to a closed group of elite buyers.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

0WoLHxcEDfHig6LB.description: When the fence successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints}, their target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the fence's attacks until the end of the fence's next turn. On a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against all attacks until the end of the fence's next turn.
0WoLHxcEDfHig6LB.name: Scoundrel's Feint

CBVdyLeHnsGw5evo.description:
Activate A Interact

With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

The radius of the burst is 5 feet.
CBVdyLeHnsGw5evo.name: Smokestick (Lesser)

USUUbgjaNlr0tqdX.description:
Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7UL8belWmo7U5YGM]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)}
USUUbgjaNlr0tqdX.name: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)

blPj44XSQdjiu1MS.description: Fences live by their ability to recognize a viable trade. They can use Underworld Lore to identify an item's value and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.eReSHVEPCsdkSL4G]{Identify Magic} on an item. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Underworld Lore checks when doing so, and to Underworld Lore checks to determine whether an item was stolen, whether a stolen item would be too recognizable to easily move, and who would be interested in purchasing such an item.
blPj44XSQdjiu1MS.name: Fence's Eye

cMz56RGF3H0a0ZQi.description: The fence always has a few items close at hand. The fence @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interacts} to draw a weapon or item that takes a single action to activate, and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} with the weapon or activates the item.
cMz56RGF3H0a0ZQi.name: Quick Rummage

pA5rSYohIHad8O4a.description:
You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.
pA5rSYohIHad8O4a.name: Thieves' Tools

ttSdjINAYV0VxPZk.description: The fence deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
ttSdjINAYV0VxPZk.name: Sneak Attack

ye3X09juCQpFV4T2.description: This small wooden box contains cosmetics, false facial hair, spirit gum, and a few simple wigs. You usually need a disguise kit to set up a disguise in order to Impersonate someone using the Deception skill. If you've crafted a large number of disguises, you can replenish your cosmetics supply with replacement cosmetics suitable for the type of your disguise kit.
ye3X09juCQpFV4T2.name: Disguise Kit

Fence (PFS 2-00).name: Fence (PFS 2-00)

8SVJAkGeub65XLkC.description: The grindylow moves up to 60 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering reactions. It can use this ability while grabbing a creature.
8SVJAkGeub65XLkC.name: Jet

MBoQQVoF3ws3HLwy.description:
Trigger A creature attempts a melee attack against a zombie grindylow with a bludgeoning or slashing weapon

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:15] saving throw or become tangled in the kelp that surrounds the zombie grindylow, giving the creature a -10 circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it spends a manipulate action to remove the kelp.
MBoQQVoF3ws3HLwy.name: Tangling Kelp

UUaxUn8e1vkuaaXd.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
UUaxUn8e1vkuaaXd.name: Slow

yG0DUDJ68F3sYK7P.description:
When a grindylow Grabs a creature larger than itself, it attaches to that creature. The grabbed creature is not immobilized, but if it moves, the grindylow moves with it.

If the creature is Medium or smaller, it takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds while the grindylow is attached. The grindylow is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while it is attached to a creature.
yG0DUDJ68F3sYK7P.name: Clinging Suckers

W6noQhWuklyayC1t.description:
A fire-eye zombie can launch its eye at foes. While its eye is out of its head, the fire-eye zombie is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}.

At the end of its turn, a fire-eye zombie's eye flies back into its eye socket.
W6noQhWuklyayC1t.name: Eye Throwing

WCbXOYW55njv5jXG.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
WCbXOYW55njv5jXG.name: Slow

WqeQzrDArNCcoIcF.description:
10 feet. The fire-eye zombie emits an aura of heat that causes open wounds to sizzle.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and isn't at full HP must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage as its wounds burn.

Creatures critically hit by the fire-eye zombie's Strikes must attempt this saving throw immediately.
WqeQzrDArNCcoIcF.name: Searing Aura

37XUiSCPpy3SyVwg.description:
10 feet. The fire-eye zombie emits an aura of heat that causes open wounds to sizzle.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and isn't at full HP must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage as its wounds burn.

Creatures critically hit by the fire-eye zombie's Strikes must attempt this saving throw immediately.
37XUiSCPpy3SyVwg.name: Searing Aura

3IDgvcfodmDT9Trl.description: The fire-eye cyclops zombie makes a spiked club Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the Strike's reach. This attack counts as two attacks for the fire-eye zombie's multiple attack penalty.
3IDgvcfodmDT9Trl.name: Wide Swing

D2DlGUD9GA5d9gj1.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
D2DlGUD9GA5d9gj1.name: Slow

NSrkmgeoEIMlRGQY.description:
A fire-eye zombie can launch its eye at foes. While its eye is out of its head, the fire-eye zombie is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}.

At the end of its turn, a fire-eye zombie's eye flies back into its eye socket.
NSrkmgeoEIMlRGQY.name: Eye Throwing

3g2l9ydocvf28khl.description: A brimorak's hooves and any weapon they wield burst into flame, dealing an extra @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage with each hit. If they don't have a weapon, they can create a flaming sword of fire and steel (see flaming sword Strike in Melee entry above).
3g2l9ydocvf28khl.name: Flaming Weapon

7ullxbvs8wpmjlzq.description: Smoke doesn't impair a brimorak's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.
7ullxbvs8wpmjlzq.name: Smoke Vision

UuqPqeg4NuXkMWCm.description:
You call in a favor from another demon whose level is no more than double Abyssal pact's spell rank, two demons whose levels are each at least 2 less than double the spell rank, or three demons whose levels are each at least 3 less than double the spell rank.

Critical Success You conjure the demon or demons. They are eager to pursue the task, so they don't ask for a favor.

Success You conjure the demon or demons. They are not eager to pursue the task, so they require a favor in return.

Failure You don't conjure any demons.

Critical Failure The demon or demons are angry that you disturbed them. They appear before you, but they immediately attack you.
UuqPqeg4NuXkMWCm.name: Abyssal Pact

XN9pFXv65acimgmA.description:
Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.
XN9pFXv65acimgmA.name: Dimension Door

a3d0hy3dj9u9pntm.description: Each time an adjacent creature deals slashing or piercing damage to the brimorak, the attacker is sprayed with the brimorak's boiling blood, which deals @Damage[3d4[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).
a3d0hy3dj9u9pntm.name: Boiling Blood

c52mxlmgfax2xrkf.description: The brimorak emits a cloud of thick black smoke in a @Template[burst|distance:10]{10-foot burst} that remains in place for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. All creatures within the smoke become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the smoke become concealed to creatures within it. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the smoke it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).
c52mxlmgfax2xrkf.name: Fume

etiSlcJIEnKhzYSg.description:
A roaring blast of fire appears at a spot you designate, dealing 6d6 fire damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.
etiSlcJIEnKhzYSg.name: Fireball

fzrpqq4mvr4g5s36.description: Dousing a brimorak with water, either ordinary water or from a water effect, causes no physical harm to the fiend but deals @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage. Fully immersing the brimorak in water deals @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage per round.
fzrpqq4mvr4g5s36.name: Extinguishing Aversion

ornom9b33sn8mps5.description:
The brimorak spits their boiling blood in a @Template[line|distance:20]{20-foot line} that deals @Damage[8d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save).

The brimorak can't use their Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

The ground within this area becomes slippery, with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} spell targeting an area until it's cleaned up or the brimorak is able to use their Breath Weapon again, whichever comes first.
ornom9b33sn8mps5.name: Breath Weapon

Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).description: The demon lord Urxehl manifests upon Golarion a small region of his Abyssal realm, filled with constantly burning forests lashed by fierce storms and unholy rain that only further feeds the flames. This is a mystical fire, fueled by the presence of Urxehl's minions. Any flames on the map emit concealing smoke in a 10-foot radius around the fire.
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[nature|dc:17] or @Check[performance|dc:17] (trained) to remind the Finadar forest of its true self; or @Check[religion|dc:17], @Check[occultism|dc:17], or @Check[demon-lore|dc:17]{Demon Lore}(trained) to disrupt the connection to the imposed realm and extinguish one of the five sections of flames on the map. These checks can only be attempted by creatures adjacent to the section, and each attempt takes 2 actions. An extinguished fire still emits concealing smoke for 1 additional round but is no longer hot enough to deal damage. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} spell or a spell with the water trait (2nd level; counteract DC 15) extinguishes a section of flames. If the PCs disable three of the five sections of the flames of Verakivhan, the hazard is too weakened to sustain itself, and the remaining flames disappear. If there are no demons or elementals remaining in the area, the hazard is automatically disabled.
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).hazardRoutine: (3 actions) Any creature within the flames takes @Damage[(1d6+3)[fire]] damage, and any creature adjacent to the flames takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Flames of Verakivhan|traits:fire] save). Additionally, the flames call down a fiery rain that deals @Damage[(1d6+3)[fire]] damage to a random PC within the planar overlay (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Flames of Verakivhan|traits:fire] save). If any PCs attempted to disable the hazard that turn, the fiery rain chooses one of them as its target.
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).name: Flames of Verakivhan (3-4)

Flames of Verakivhan (5-6).description: The demon lord Urxehl manifests upon Golarion a small region of his Abyssal realm, filled with constantly burning forests lashed by fierce storms and unholy rain that only further feeds the flames. This is a mystical fire, fueled by the presence of Urxehl's minions. Any flames on the map emit concealing smoke in a 10-foot radius around the fire.
Flames of Verakivhan (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[nature|dc:20] or @Check[performance|dc:20] (trained) to remind the Finadar forest of its true self; or @Check[religion|dc:20], @Check[occultism|dc:20], or @Check[demon-lore|dc:20]{Demon Lore}(trained) to disrupt the connection to the imposed realm and extinguish one of the five sections of flames on the map. These checks can only be attempted by creatures adjacent to the section, and each attempt takes 2 actions. An extinguished fire still emits concealing smoke for 1 additional round but is no longer hot enough to deal damage. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} spell or a spell with the water trait (2nd level; counteract DC 17) extinguishes a section of flames. If the PCs disable three of the five sections of the flames of Verakivhan, the hazard is too weakened to sustain itself, and the remaining flames disappear. If there are no demons or elementals remaining in the area, the hazard is automatically disabled.
Flames of Verakivhan (5-6).hazardRoutine: (3 actions) Any creature within the flames takes @Damage[(1d10+6)[fire]] damage, and any creature adjacent to the flames takes @Damage[1d10[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Flames of Verakivhan|traits:fire]). Additionally, the flames call down a fiery rain that deals @Damage[(1d10+6)[fire]] damage to a random PC within the planar overlay (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Flames of Verakivhan|traits:fire] save). If any PCs attempted to disable the hazard that turn, the fiery rain chooses one of them as its target.
Flames of Verakivhan (5-6).name: Flames of Verakivhan (5-6)

eFeUEWJ1TjADrQjO.description: When the flaming eye dies, it explodes in a violent burst of flame, dealing @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic] save) to creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:5].
eFeUEWJ1TjADrQjO.name: Explode

eFeUEWJ1TjADrQjO.description: When the flaming eye dies, it explodes in a violent burst of flame, dealing @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save) to creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:5].
eFeUEWJ1TjADrQjO.name: Explode

32sJ45kKGClodunO.description:
5 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save.

Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
32sJ45kKGClodunO.name: Smoldering Stench

Flooding Monolith (3-4).description: A surge of abyssal energy creates a powerful wave pushing away from the monolith.
Flooding Monolith (3-4).hazardDisable:
@Check[arcana|dc:18], @Check[occultism|dc:18], or @Check[religion|dc:18] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:21] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both).

Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|name:Flooding Monolith] save).
Flooding Monolith (3-4).hazardRoutine:
(1 action) On the hazard's turn it sends a wave of water along the fork of the river (North, South, or East) that contains the nearest PC. Any creature along that fork in or on the surface of the water must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18|name:Flooding Monolith] save.

The monolith's guardians are accustomed to these surges and are immune to this effect.

Critical Success The creature takes advantage of the undertow after the surge to reposition themselves. The creature can Step, ignoring difficult terrain caused by the water.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is pushed 10 feet away from the monolith.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed 15 feet away from the monolith and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
Flooding Monolith (3-4).name: Flooding Monolith (3-4)

Flooding Monolith (5-6).description: A surge of abyssal energy creates a powerful wave pushing away from the monolith.
Flooding Monolith (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:22], @Check[occultism|dc:22], or @Check[religion|dc:22] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:25] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both). Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).
Flooding Monolith (5-6).hazardRoutine:
(1 action) On the hazard's turn it sends a wave of water along the fork of the river (North, South, or East) that contains the nearest PC. Any creature along that fork in or on the surface of the water must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22|name:Flooding Monolith] save.

The monolith's guardians are accustomed to these surges and are immune to this effect.

Critical Success The creature takes advantage of the undertow after the surge to reposition themselves. The creature can Step, ignoring difficult terrain caused by the water.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is pushed 10 feet away from the monolith.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed 15 feet away from the monolith and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
Flooding Monolith (5-6).name: Flooding Monolith (5-6)

Foretold Ruin (1-2).description: Daemonic curses slither and crawl through malevolent runes carved in four stone pillars. HP is per-pillar.
Foretold Ruin (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:17|name:Disable Thievery] (trained) to scratch out a pillar's runes, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (1st level; counteract DC 15) to counteract a pillar's magic, or @Check[athletics|dc:18|name:Disable Athletics|traits:action:force-open]{Athletics (Force Open)} to push a pillar over. Disabling a pillar requires two actions. Disabling all four pillars or slaying Sezruth disables the trap
Foretold Ruin (1-2).hazardRoutine:
Routine (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled pillar. On its initiative, the trap uses each action to afflict a different non-evil creature in the room with thirst. The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17|name:Foretold Ruin|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune to additional negative effects from the foretold ruin hazard's reaction for 24 hours. The hazard has no awareness of this immunity and continues to target this creature.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} until they drink water. If the creature was already fatigued, they take @Damage[1d6[nonlethal,mental]]{1d6 nonlethal mental} damage.

Critical Failure The creature is fatigued until they drink water and takes 1d6 nonlethal mental damage. If the creature was already fatigued, they instead take @Damage[2d6[nonlethal,mental]]{2d6 nonlethal mental} damage.
Foretold Ruin (1-2).name: Foretold Ruin (1-2)

Foretold Ruin (3-4).description: Daemonic curses slither and crawl through malevolent runes carved in four stone pillars. HP is per-pillar.
Foretold Ruin (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Disable Thievery] (trained) to scratch out a pillar's runes, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd level; counteract DC 18) to counteract a pillar's magic, or @Check[athletics|dc:21|name:Disable Athletics|traits:action:force-open]{Athletics (Force Open)} to push a pillar over. Disabling a pillar requires two actions. Disabling all four pillars or slaying Sezruth disables the trap
Foretold Ruin (3-4).hazardRoutine:
Routine (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled pillar. On its initiative, the trap uses each action to afflict a different non-evil creature in the room with thirst. The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20|name:Foretold Ruin|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune to additional negative effects from the foretold ruin hazard's reaction for 24 hours. The hazard has no awareness of this immunity and continues to target this creature.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} until they drink water. If the creature was already fatigued, they take @Damage[1d6[nonlethal,mental]]{1d6 nonlethal mental} damage.

Critical Failure The creature is fatigued until they drink water and takes 1d6 nonlethal mental damage. If the creature was already fatigued, they instead take @Damage[2d6[nonlethal,mental]]{2d6 nonlethal mental} damage.
Foretold Ruin (3-4).name: Foretold Ruin (3-4)

G6iIf6shT68NDbTW.description: A frost troll hunter isn't impeded by difficult terrain caused by snow or ice, nor do they need to attempt Acrobatics checks to keep from falling on slippery ice.
G6iIf6shT68NDbTW.name: Ice Stride

OPBJuHhEVoiEk4mU.description: The frost troll hunter's feet and weapons move in tandem. They can either Step and then Strike, or Strike and then Step.
OPBJuHhEVoiEk4mU.name: Skirmish Strike

hvk3jTMWT9RaDiBH.description: The frostbitten trollhound deals an extra 1d4 damage to creatures within reach of at least two of its allies.
hvk3jTMWT9RaDiBH.name: Pack Attack

viQYjDAyUKgEOmaJ.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 Enfeebled 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 day)

Stage 5 Enfeebled 2, Clumsy 2, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)
viQYjDAyUKgEOmaJ.name: Bloodfire Fever

iwRD5iTmlbMyJBRF.description:
Requirements The giant worker ant has a Large or smaller creature grabbed

Effect The giant worker ant Strides up to its full Speed, carrying the grabbed creature with it. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered} if the grabbed creature is Medium or larger.
iwRD5iTmlbMyJBRF.name: Haul Away

OgeeLdGttAsxjjCc.description: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand-and-a-half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.
OgeeLdGttAsxjjCc.name: Bastard Sword

Wduouw2belSvL4Xj.description: Glorzia gains a +3 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures she has grabbed.
Wduouw2belSvL4Xj.name: Mauler

XEB79A5dsQFX25yf.description: Glorzia Strides up to 10 feet and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature she's undetected by. If she succeeds, she also deals fist damage to that creature.
XEB79A5dsQFX25yf.name: Bushwhack

2SAK2u9pNu8TcIZp.description:
You shield the target against dangerous temperatures. Choose severe cold or heat. The target is protected from the temperature you chose (but not extreme cold or heat).

Heightened (3rd) The target is protected from severe cold and heat.

Heightened (5th) The target is protected from severe cold, severe heat, extreme cold, and extreme heat.
2SAK2u9pNu8TcIZp.name: Endure Elements

CGmwy4QUbq1bJx2n.description:
You call forth a powerful blast of pressurized water that bludgeons the target and knocks it back. Make a ranged spell attack roll.

Critical Success The target takes 6d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 10 feet.

Success The target takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 5 feet.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.
CGmwy4QUbq1bJx2n.name: Hydraulic Push

UGJPxqKMa0aKLBWa.description: Explorer's clothing is sturdy enough that it can be reinforced to protect you, even though it isn't a suit of armor. It comes in many forms, though the most common sorts look like clerical vestments, monk's garments, or wizard's robes, as members of all three classes are likely to avoid wearing armor.
UGJPxqKMa0aKLBWa.name: Explorer's Clothing

WKa28jhXRLzBkPcd.description: Plants in the area entangle creatures. The area counts as difficult terrain. Each round that a creature starts its turn in the area, it must attempt a Reflex save. On a failure, it takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it leaves the area, and on a critical failure, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round. Creatures can attempt to Escape at entangle's DC to remove these effects.
WKa28jhXRLzBkPcd.name: Entangle

fTMWpP5lJyZ6HKym.description:
An arc of lightning leaps from one target to another. You deal electricity damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.
fTMWpP5lJyZ6HKym.name: Electric Arc

jfhnpshH6CE63TLc.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).
jfhnpshH6CE63TLc.name: Detect Magic

u9nE7QuSAgOEEnpR.description: Vitality energy shuts death's door. The target loses the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} condition, though it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} at 0 Hit Points.
u9nE7QuSAgOEEnpR.name: Stabilize

4zBVRlpdwC1IsFnG.description:
Your touch afflicts the target with goblin pox, an irritating allergenic rash. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.

Goblin Pox (disease) Level 1. Goblins and goblin dogs are immune.

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and the creature can't reduce its Sickened value below 1 (1 day)

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The target is afflicted with goblin pox at stage 1.

Critical Failure The target is afflicted with goblin pox at stage 2.
4zBVRlpdwC1IsFnG.name: Goblin Pox

63BG0L8vVF5JdKtl.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).
63BG0L8vVF5JdKtl.name: Detect Magic

Hd2mRqB3HRRUgbg4.description:
An arc of lightning leaps from one target to another. You deal electricity damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.
Hd2mRqB3HRRUgbg4.name: Electric Arc

OW92D9HK7qpgM3bK.description:
You call forth a powerful blast of pressurized water that bludgeons the target and knocks it back. Make a ranged spell attack roll.

Critical Success The target takes 6d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 10 feet.

Success The target takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 5 feet.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.
OW92D9HK7qpgM3bK.name: Hydraulic Push

OXAoa4SwoooiYm4V.description:
Tiny clinging hairs sprout across the creature's hands and feet, offering purchase on nearly any surface. The target gains a climb Speed equal to its Speed.

Heightened (5th) The duration increases to 1 hour.
OXAoa4SwoooiYm4V.name: Spider Climb

cOaY6PP7pvUQPsNc.description: Vitality energy shuts death's door. The target loses the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} condition, though it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} at 0 Hit Points.
cOaY6PP7pvUQPsNc.name: Stabilize

czloXYPvF72qJ7J7.description:
You shield the target against dangerous temperatures. Choose severe cold or heat. The target is protected from the temperature you chose (but not extreme cold or heat).

Heightened (3rd) The target is protected from severe cold and heat.

Heightened (5th) The target is protected from severe cold, severe heat, extreme cold, and extreme heat.
czloXYPvF72qJ7J7.name: Endure Elements

iFm44C31xIuQ1ukM.description: You pour healing magic through the target in an attempt to cure one poison afflicting it. Attempt a counteract check against the poison.
iFm44C31xIuQ1ukM.name: Neutralize Poison

l7xBIZB5eLaB6Tyi.description: Explorer's clothing is sturdy enough that it can be reinforced to protect you, even though it isn't a suit of armor. It comes in many forms, though the most common sorts look like clerical vestments, monk's garments, or wizard's robes, as members of all three classes are likely to avoid wearing armor.
l7xBIZB5eLaB6Tyi.name: Explorer's Clothing

xUHFAmu4BS4dWAxB.description: Plants in the area entangle creatures. The area counts as difficult terrain. Each round that a creature starts its turn in the area, it must attempt a Reflex save. On a failure, it takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it leaves the area, and on a critical failure, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round. Creatures can attempt to Escape at entangle's DC to remove these effects.
xUHFAmu4BS4dWAxB.name: Entangle

2ph7hoq3gg2wr6kx.description:
10 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d6[spirit]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d6[spirit]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d6[spirit]] damage and is frightened 1 as long as the portal to the Abyss remains open.
2ph7hoq3gg2wr6kx.name: Dominating Will

7vmhgd9oifizfpwo.description: The hand of Urxehl begins with 4 fingers embedded outside of the rift. At the beginning of the encounter, the hand is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1}, and can use this additional action to make grasping claw Strikes. For every 45 damage the hand of Urxehl takes, one of these fingers recedes and the hand loses 1 action, first losing the quickened condition, then becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} before being defeated at 0 Hit Points.
7vmhgd9oifizfpwo.name: Grasping Fingers

kkibcb6my2j14udj.description:
Trigger The hand takes enough damage to lose an action

Effect the hand thrashes about in pain, causing a minor earthquake. Creatures within 60 feet of the portal must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:28] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
kkibcb6my2j14udj.name: Thrash About

eginiq2ug0ustxry.description:
10 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[3d6[spirit]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[6d6[spirit]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[12d6[spirit]] damage and is frightened 1 as long as the portal to the Abyss remains open.
eginiq2ug0ustxry.name: Dominating Will

finhkg03q277yos4.description: The hand of Urxehl begins with 4 fingers embedded outside of the rift. At the beginning of the encounter, the hand is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1}, and can use this additional action to make grasping claw Strikes. For every 60 damage the hand of Urxehl takes, one of these fingers recedes and the hand loses 1 action, first losing the quickened condition, then becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} before being defeated at 0 Hit Points.
finhkg03q277yos4.name: Grasping Fingers

glkgq6m1oe7966fu.description:
Trigger The hand takes enough damage to lose an action

/n

Effect the hand thrashes about in pain, causing a minor earthquake. Creatures within 60 feet of the portal must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:30] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
glkgq6m1oe7966fu.name: Thrash About

Hands of Slow Death.description: A pile of dust and bone meal, several inches deep and 10 feet across on each side, blocks the tunnel to the surface. It is suffused with the despair of the slowly dying, and summons vengeful skeletal hands to hunt down anyone who dares attempt to leave the area.
Hands of Slow Death.hazardDisable:
@Check[religion|dc:15|name:Administer Burial Rites|traits:haunt] (trained) to speak the proper burial rites, @Check[occultism|dc:15|name:Exorcise Spirits|traits:haunt] (trained) to exorcise the lingering souls, or @Check[intimidation|dc:17|name:Scare Away Spirits|traits:haunt] to scare the fearful souls away.

These actions have the verbal trait. Each check to disable the hazard requires 2 actions, and two total successes are required to disable the haunt.
Hands of Slow Death.hazardReset: The haunt deactivates if no creatures remain within 30 feet but resets immediately thereafter unless disabled. If tthe haunt is disabled, it resets after 24 hours.
Hands of Slow Death.hazardRoutine: (1 action) Spectral hands grasp at creatures in the area. Each creature within 30 feet of the dust pile takes @Damage[1d4[void]] damage (@Check[will|dc:17|basic|name:Grasping Hands] save; creatures that critically fail this saving throw are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round).
Hands of Slow Death.name: Hands of Slow Death

Hidden Bog.description: This section of grass-strewn ground hides a pool of sticky mud 10 feet across.
Hidden Bog.hazardDisable: 2 @Check[crafting|dc:15|name:Create a makeshift plank|traits:environmental] or 2 @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Create a makeshift plank|traits:environmental] to create a makeshift plank across the hidden bog; creatures can then traverse the hazard's area without stepping into the mud.
Hidden Bog.hazardReset: Creatures can still step into the mud after the trap is revealed, but the area containing the mud is obvious.
Hidden Bog.name: Hidden Bog

ve2YkqSn16RJqx9x.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.
ve2YkqSn16RJqx9x.name: Longsword

Hunting Spider (PFS 2-18).description:
Hunting spiders are the most common type of giant spider, though not the largest.

Few everyday vermin inspire as much dread as the infamous spider.

4lmj5hd20I5GvQJz.description:
Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled.

Trigger A creature touches the hunting spider's web while the spider is on it.

Effect The hunting spider automatically notices the creature and Strides, Climbs, or Descends on a Web before it rolls initiative.
4lmj5hd20I5GvQJz.name: Spring Upon Prey

DbfLZXVZVTQMJoyI.description: The hunting spider has imprecise @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.
DbfLZXVZVTQMJoyI.name: Web Sense

Qy7s2ZDFTvr7xR1m.description: A creature hit by the hunting spider's web attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 17).
Qy7s2ZDFTvr7xR1m.name: Web Trap

egV0y60X9Okkmuoc.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and off-guard (1 round)
egV0y60X9Okkmuoc.name: Hunting Spider Venom

tHBnPDgoj9trVlBk.description:
The hunting spider moves straight down up to 40 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count for falling damage.

A creature that successfully Strikes the web (AC 20, Hardness 3, 5 HP) severs it, causing the spider to fall.
tHBnPDgoj9trVlBk.name: Descend on a Web

Hunting Spider (PFS 2-18).name: Hunting Spider (PFS 2-18)

Ice Slick.description: A sheer slick of ice causes anyone other than Ssalarn who attempts to cross it to slip and fall.
Ice Slick.hazardDisable: 2 @Check[athletics|dc:18|name:Break Ice Slick|traits:environmental] to break the ice and roughen its surface
Ice Slick.name: Ice Slick

WDttWBnICVwt2mYo.description:
The dragon forest rot breathes a toxic cloud that deals @Damage[7d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:23|basic] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.
WDttWBnICVwt2mYo.name: Breath Weapon

b3SbLDyYjM3QmXhM.description: 20 feet. A creature that enters or starts its turn in the emanation must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. On a critical failure, the creature also takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to the of all dragon forest rots for 1 minute.
b3SbLDyYjM3QmXhM.name: Stench

nmiINLl4XQwyT4oE.description: If the forest rot takes fire damage, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its turn.
nmiINLl4XQwyT4oE.name: Flame-Scorched

oEduKuW4WaDIp98Z.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature damages the dragon forest rot.

Effect The dragon forest rot sprays spores on the triggering creature. The spores deal @Damage[(2d6+9)[piercing]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:23|basic] save. On a critical failure, the triggering creature gains weakness to slashing 5 for the next 4 rounds.
oEduKuW4WaDIp98Z.name: Spores

1L2j9nKYiWTY3CzC.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Iverri's last action was a successful thorn spike Strike that damaged the target

Effect Iverri transforms the thorns into burrowing maggots, infusing the target with a fell curse to bind it to her. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save to resist the curse; on a failure, this binding lasts until the end of Iverri's next turn.

While the binding is active, Iverri takes only half damage from all effects that deal Hit Point damage, and the target takes the remainder of the damage. When the target takes damage from the bond, it doesn't apply any resistances, weaknesses, or other abilities it has to that damage.
1L2j9nKYiWTY3CzC.name: Parasitic Bond

5i7I5KzdRqDf6FTO.description:
You step into a living tree with a trunk big enough for you to fit inside it and instantly teleport to any tree of the same species within 5 miles that also has a sufficiently large trunk. Once you enter the first tree, you instantly know the rough locations of other sufficiently large trees of the same species within range and can exit from the original tree, if you prefer. You can't carry extradimensional spaces with you; if you attempt to do so, the spell fails.

Heightened (6th) The tree you exit can be up to 50 miles away.

Heightened (8th) The tree you exit can be up to 500 miles away.

Heightened (9th) The tree you exit can be anywhere on the same planet.
5i7I5KzdRqDf6FTO.name: Tree Stride

9tm3qPa56L87YG9u.description: You transform into a Large tree. Perception checks don't reveal your true nature, but a successful Nature or Survival check against your spell DC reveals that you appear to be a tree that is strangely new to the area. While in tree form, you can observe everything around you, but you can't act other than to end the spell, and your turn, by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait. As a tree, your AC is 20, and only status bonuses, status penalties, circumstance bonuses, and circumstance penalties affect you. Any successes and critical successes you roll on Reflex saves are failures.
9tm3qPa56L87YG9u.name: Tree Shape (At Will)

GlUob8aVOoJ64MFd.description:
Toxic spores swarm over creatures in the area, causing them to erupt in grotesque fungal growths. These noxious growths deal 2d6 persistent poison damage, and each creature must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The target takes half the persistent poison damage.

Failure The target takes the full persistent poison damage. While it is taking this persistent poison damage, it has weakness 1 to fire and weakness 1 to slashing.

Critical Failure As failure, but double the persistent poison damage. While it is taking this persistent poison damage, it has weakness 2 to fire and weakness 2 to slashing.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.6gRRjn0h0DAUh7nQ]{Spell Effect: Fungal Infestation}

Heightened (+2) The persistent damage increases by 2d6, and the weakness increases by 1, or by 2 on a critical failure.
GlUob8aVOoJ64MFd.name: Fungal Infestation

Psbu3qnstyoO0R6h.description:
You accelerate the processes of decay in the area. Each living creature in the area takes @Damage[2d10[void]] damage (basic Fortitude save). A creature afflicted by a disease takes a -2 circumstance penalty to this save.You can also direct the blight to rot all Small and Tiny non-creature plants in the area, eliminating non-magical undergrowth and any resulting difficult terrain, cover, and concealment. Sudden blight attempts to counteract any magical effect on the plants before withering them.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d10.
Psbu3qnstyoO0R6h.name: Sudden Blight

UyZ35kgtIloqkbqS.description:
A vine covered in sticky sap appears from thin air, flicking from your hand and lashing itself to the target. Attempt a spell attack against the target.

Critical Success The target gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition and takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition.

Success The target takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.TwtUIEyenrtAbeiX]{Spell Effect: Tangle Vine}

Failure The target is unaffected.

Heightened (2nd) The effects last for 2 rounds.

Heightened (4th) The effects last for 1 minute.
UyZ35kgtIloqkbqS.name: Tanglefoot

ZtkTwr7wmQ6O8xsA.description: Plants in the area entangle creatures. The area counts as difficult terrain. Each round that a creature starts its turn in the area, it must attempt a Reflex save. On a failure, it takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it leaves the area, and on a critical failure, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round. Creatures can attempt to Escape at entangle's DC to remove these effects.
ZtkTwr7wmQ6O8xsA.name: Entangle (At Will)

aqjc16cJUsVTkOf5.description: You can ask questions of and receive answers from plants, but the spell doesn't make them more friendly or intelligent than normal. Most normal plants have a distinctive view of the world around them, so they don't recognize details about creatures or know anything about the world beyond their immediate vicinity. Cunning plant monsters are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.
aqjc16cJUsVTkOf5.name: Speak with Plants (Constant)

mfFPk1CiQVkKx7jq.description:
Your honeyed words are difficult for creatures to resist. You suggest a course of action to the target, which must be phrased in such a way as to seem like a logical course of action to the target and can't be self-destructive or obviously against the target's self-interest. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and knows you tried to control it.

Success The target is unaffected and thinks you were talking to them normally, not casting a spell on them.

Failure The target immediately follows your suggestion. The spell has a duration of 1 minute, or until the target has completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects.

Critical Failure As failure, but the base duration is 1 hour.

Heightened (8th) You can target up to 10 creatures.
mfFPk1CiQVkKx7jq.name: Suggestion

yX383dEhKhkqSvA2.description: Instead of being bonded to a specific tree, Iverri is bonded to blighted areas formerly ravaged by the Abyss. If she does not remain within 300 feet of at least one blighted tree, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and is unable to recover. She must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save every hour or increase the sickened value by 1 (to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 4}). After 24 hours, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, with this value increasing by 1 every additional 24 hours.
yX383dEhKhkqSvA2.name: Blight Dependent

Iverri (3-4).name: Iverri (3-4)
Iverri (3-4).npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

1L2j9nKYiWTY3CzC.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Iverri's last action was a successful thorn spike Strike that damaged the target

Effect Iverri transforms the thorns into burrowing maggots, infusing the target with a fell curse to bind it to her. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save to resist the curse; on a failure, this binding lasts until the end of Iverri's next turn.

While the binding is active, Iverri takes only half damage from all effects that deal Hit Point damage, and the target takes the remainder of the damage. When the target takes damage from the bond, it doesn't apply any resistances, weaknesses, or other abilities it has to that damage.

Perception checks don't reveal your true nature, but a successful Nature or Survival check against your spell DC reveals that you appear to be a tree that is strangely new to the area. While in tree form, you can observe everything around you, but you can't act other than to end the spell, and your turn, by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait. As a tree, your AC is 20, and only status bonuses, status penalties, circumstance bonuses, and circumstance penalties affect you. Any successes and critical successes you roll on Reflex saves are failures.

It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition.

Success The target takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.TwtUIEyenrtAbeiX]{Spell Effect: Tangle Vine}

Failure The target is unaffected.

Heightened (2nd) The effects last for 2 rounds.

Heightened (4th) The effects last for 1 minute.
DwJ6tGh27ie4ndU4.name: Tanglefoot

You accelerate the processes of decay in the area. Each living creature in the area takes @Damage[2d10[void]] damage (basic Fortitude save). A creature afflicted by a disease takes a -2 circumstance penalty to this save.You can also direct the blight to rot all Small and Tiny non-creature plants in the area, eliminating non-magical undergrowth and any resulting difficult terrain, cover, and concealment. Sudden blight attempts to counteract any magical effect on the plants before withering them.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d10.
Ia4d5G86dKLiK1fc.name: Sudden Blight

KPUQ6VoaSpFRqKjm.description:
Over the course of a minute, you cause a thick wall of thorny brambles to grow from the ground. You create a 5-foot-thick wall of brambles and thorns in a straight line up to 60 feet long and 10 feet high. You must create the wall in an unbroken open space so its edges don't pass through any creatures or objects, or the spell is lost. The wall stands vertically. If you wish, the wall can be of a shorter length or height. Everything on each side of the wall has cover from creatures on the opposite side, and the wall's spaces are difficult terrain. For every move action a creature uses to enter at least one of the wall's spaces, that creature takes 3d4 piercing damage.

Each 5-foot-by-5-foot section of the wall has AC 10, Hardness 10, and 20 Hit Points. It's immune to critical hits and precision damage. A destroyed section can be moved through freely.

Heightened (+1) The Hit Points of each section of the wall increase by 5, and the piercing damage increases by 1d4.
KPUQ6VoaSpFRqKjm.name: Wall of Thorns

Uf4itLQg6tq9HuzK.description:
You step into a living tree with a trunk big enough for you to fit inside it and instantly teleport to any tree of the same species within 5 miles that also has a sufficiently large trunk. Once you enter the first tree, you instantly know the rough locations of other sufficiently large trees of the same species within range and can exit from the original tree, if you prefer. You can't carry extradimensional spaces with you; if you attempt to do so, the spell fails.

Heightened (6th) The tree you exit can be up to 50 miles away.

Heightened (8th) The tree you exit can be up to 500 miles away.

Heightened (9th) The tree you exit can be anywhere on the same planet.
Uf4itLQg6tq9HuzK.name: Tree Stride

You suggest a course of action to the target, which must be phrased in such a way as to seem like a logical course of action to the target and can't be self-destructive or obviously against the target's self-interest. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and knows you tried to control it.

Success The target is unaffected and thinks you were talking to them normally, not casting a spell on them.

Failure The target immediately follows your suggestion. The spell has a duration of 1 minute, or until the target has completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects.

ZoF2ZZJTUxc9ntdn.name: Suggestion

cGGD46CJtuCV3v2r.description: Plants in the area entangle creatures. The area counts as difficult terrain. Each round that a creature starts its turn in the area, it must attempt a Reflex save. On a failure, it takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it leaves the area, and on a critical failure, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round. Creatures can attempt to Escape at entangle's DC to remove these effects.
cGGD46CJtuCV3v2r.name: Entangle (At Will)

jkAEGGIa1MPnlvHA.description:
Toxic spores swarm over creatures in the area, causing them to erupt in grotesque fungal growths. These noxious growths deal 2d6 persistent poison damage, and each creature must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The target takes half the persistent poison damage.

Failure The target takes the full persistent poison damage. While it is taking this persistent poison damage, it has weakness 1 to fire and weakness 1 to slashing.

Critical Failure As failure, but double the persistent poison damage. While it is taking this persistent poison damage, it has weakness 2 to fire and weakness 2 to slashing.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.6gRRjn0h0DAUh7nQ]{Spell Effect: Fungal Infestation}

Heightened (+2) The persistent damage increases by 2d6, and the weakness increases by 1, or by 2 on a critical failure.
jkAEGGIa1MPnlvHA.name: Fungal Infestation (At Will)

ldGX1e6bWln6N0kA.description: You can ask questions of and receive answers from plants, but the spell doesn't make them more friendly or intelligent than normal. Most normal plants have a distinctive view of the world around them, so they don't recognize details about creatures or know anything about the world beyond their immediate vicinity. Cunning plant monsters are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.
ldGX1e6bWln6N0kA.name: Speak with Plants (Constant)

yX383dEhKhkqSvA2.description: Instead of being bonded to a specific tree, Iverri is bonded to blighted areas formerly ravaged by the Abyss. If she does not remain within 300 feet of at least one blighted tree, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and is unable to recover. She must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save every hour or increase the sickened value by 1 (to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 4}). After 24 hours, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, with this value increasing by 1 every additional 24 hours.
yX383dEhKhkqSvA2.name: Blight Dependent

Iverri (5-6).name: Iverri (5-6)
Iverri (5-6).npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Jinkin (PFS 2-00).description:
Jinkins are sadistic tinkers who steal and sabotage items and take great pride in their power to curse precious objects. They hold grudges and create convoluted plans for revenge whenever they feel slighted, such as when a creature dares to remove one of their curses. Rarely content to wreak simple mayhem, jinkins also take immense pleasure in torture and murder, though they prefer to lead victims into traps designed to capture or incapacitate rather than kill outright. Deep pits are favorites, since victims who survive the fall face a slow death from starvation and thirst. Jinkins enjoy gathering at the edge of pits to mock, tease, and torment.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life on the Material Plane, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. All gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the lightest and slightest, carefully targeted push from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom gremlins (and many others) derisively call "mites."

fHam88iT0r3U5tcl.description: A group of six jinkins can work together for an hour to imbue an item with a curse at a range of 60 feet. While this process is lengthy, it's also unobtrusive and can be performed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding}. Jinkins prefer to use this ability on magic items. The curse makes the item unreliable (@Check[flat|dc:5] check or waste any action to Interact with or Activate the item), adds a bizarre requirement to use the item, or imparts some other curse of a similar caliber.
fHam88iT0r3U5tcl.name: Tinker

iqKvwR33VgnA6XRV.description:
The simplest magic does your bidding. You can perform simple magical effects for as long as you Sustain the Spell. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can choose one of four options.

  • Cook Cool, warm, or flavor 1 pound of nonliving material.
  • Lift Slowly lift an unattended object of light Bulk or less 1 foot off the ground.
  • Make Create a temporary object of negligible Bulk, made of congealed magical substance. The object looks crude and artificial and is extremely fragile-it can't be used as a tool, weapon, or spell component.
  • Tidy Color, clean, or soil an object of light Bulk or less. You can affect an object of 1 Bulk with 10 rounds of concentration, and a larger object a 1 minute per Bulk.

Prestidigitation can't deal damage or cause adverse conditions. Any actual change to an object (beyond what is noted above) persists only as long as you Sustain the Spell.
iqKvwR33VgnA6XRV.name: Prestidigitation

oObpBdGWzojxRdfS.description: The jinkin deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
oObpBdGWzojxRdfS.name: Sneak Attack

Jinkin (PFS 2-00).name: Jinkin (PFS 2-00)

1ICSGdDVtFdFoByC.description: The planar nixie can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and make very simple Requests of aquatic or amphibious animals and elementals.
1ICSGdDVtFdFoByC.name: Wild Empathy

8z1MC2ykPvZPeOtL.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The planar nixie can duplicate a spell of up to 3rd level, but only in response to the request or desire of a non-fey creature. The creature whose desire is granted can never again benefit from that particular planar nixie's Grant Desire ability.
8z1MC2ykPvZPeOtL.name: Grant Desire

DlyalCdjsd1S4Oah.description:
You call forth a powerful blast of pressurized water that bludgeons the target and knocks it back. Make a ranged spell attack roll.

Critical Success The target takes 6d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 10 feet.

Success The target takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 5 feet.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.
DlyalCdjsd1S4Oah.name: Hydraulic Push

MMdxCpjc43IfOikE.description:
To the target, your words are honey and your visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if you or your allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it.

You can Dismiss the spell. If you use hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with you or the actions you convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning you could potentially convince the target to continue being your friend via mundane means.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and aware you tried to charm it.

Success The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of charm, unless it identifies the spell.

Failure The target's attitude becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.v66R7FdOf11l94im]{Friendly} toward you. If it was Friendly, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.v44P3WUcU1j0115l]{Helpful}. It can't use hostile actions against you.

Critical Failure The target's attitude becomes Helpful toward you, and it can't use hostile actions against you.

Heightened (4th) The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations.

Heightened (8th) The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations, and you can target up to 10 creatures.
MMdxCpjc43IfOikE.name: Charm (At Will)

Joyful Planar Nixie.name: Joyful Planar Nixie
Joyful Planar Nixie.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

0RFa0KfekeJrXX6w.description: 30 feet. Kareida's mask hides her focus in a fight. Enemies that start their turn in the aura or enter it must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:16|name:Masked Focus] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Kareida and take a -2 circumstance penalty to saving throw DCs against skill checks Kareida makes against them until the start of their next turn. On a critical success, the foe is temporarily immune for 1 minute. If Kareida is not wearing her scarecrow mask, she loses this ability.
0RFa0KfekeJrXX6w.name: Masked Intentions

XZzJJKcamIQvGqFL.description: The boar Strides twice and then makes a tusk Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.
XZzJJKcamIQvGqFL.name: Boar Charge

YjZsr4inH9qTVsVo.description: The daeodon Strides twice and then makes a tusk Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll. A Medium or smaller creature struck by this attack must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} by the force of the blow.
YjZsr4inH9qTVsVo.name: Daeodon Charge

Frpc0KRkdnPN6zjA.description: The Kayajima guardian propels itself with jets of blue energy from its feet, dashing up to a foe and swinging its fist. It Strides twice. If it ends its movement within melee range of at least one enemy, it can make an energized fist Strike against that enemy.
Frpc0KRkdnPN6zjA.name: Sudden Charge

A to 3

If the Kayajima guardian uses 1 action to use, it unleashes a powerful blast that deals @Damage[3d6[force]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:15]. If the Kayajima guardian uses 2 actions to use Ley Line Surge, increase the size of the cone to @Template[cone|distance:30] and the damage to @Damage[5d6[force]] damage. If the Kayajima guardian uses 3 actions to use Ley Line Surge, increase the size of the cone to @Template[cone|distance:60] and the damage to @Damage[6d6[force]] damage.

Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is pushed 5 feet.

icMP8x2L8sLVpCPP.description: Like normal objects, the guardian dogu has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once the guardian is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 20.

Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11).description:
The typical kobold trains with agile weaponry, favoring the light pick for its use in crafting new tunnels to expand their domains through underground reaches. Kobolds are capable of landing sneaky strikes against unsuspecting foes but are just as quick to scamper off to safety when they don't, as a group, outnumber their enemies at least two to one.

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can. While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions.

D0BJOT03V2FE7mKT.description: The kobold warrior deals an extra 1d4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
D0BJOT03V2FE7mKT.name: Sneak Attack

dF7ibA1On3Nvjxqk.description:
Requirements The kobold warrior is adjacent to at least one enemy.

Effect The kobold warrior Strides up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.
dF7ibA1On3Nvjxqk.name: Hurried Retreat

Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11).name: Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11)

j3ELc14hlrOyqOK9.description:
Trigger The leaded skeleton is hit by a melee attack

Effect A cloud of lead dust is released, forming a @Template[burst|distance:5]{5-foot radius} cloud of fine particles surrounding the skeleton. The cloud persists for 1 round, exposing creatures within it to an inhaled form of rapid lead poison.
j3ELc14hlrOyqOK9.name: Lead Cloud

mTwyXddJq3vxuscO.description:
High amounts of lead can cause headache, difficulty concentrating, and joint pain. Necromantic magic has augmented the lead that infuses this skeleton, causing it to take effect far more quickly than is typical for lead poisoning.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, stupefied 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (2 rounds)
mTwyXddJq3vxuscO.name: Rapid Lead Poison

7Dwwk4c4cBxweZKc.description: A mandragora can smell creatures with blood as an imprecise sense at a range of 30 feet, and it can smell demons, fey, and sorcerers with blood as a precise sense at a range of 30 feet.
7Dwwk4c4cBxweZKc.name: Blood Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet

IOvxdhkIi0W0wzzB.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The mandragora emits an unsettling shriek. Each non-mandragora creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

IOvxdhkIi0W0wzzB.name: Piercing Shriek

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

If the creature is a demon, fey, or sorcerer, the mandragora gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood drained by a mandragora is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.

This long bone functions as a Bo Staff.

This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It's designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.

Lion (PFS 2-13).description:
Lions are cooperative hunters, ambushing dangerous prey in groups of lionesses that work in tandem to trap and kill their prey. Male lions are typically larger, with long manes, and when they hunt, they tend to do so on their own.

Few predators of the natural world can match the cat's talent for stalking and stealth.
