Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d8[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d8[mental]] damage and becomes either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (the aghash's choice).

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d8[mental]] damage and becomes Frightened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.
RltonTctqXIM2FmD.name: Cursed Gaze

oUnkKjSplNnoBQ1i.description:
Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.
oUnkKjSplNnoBQ1i.name: Dimension Door

taMiq6FtqyhO2Kij.description:
The Usij cultists' blood magic strengthens Sezruth. He begins with 2 Blood Points from sacrifices just before the PCs arrived, and gains 1 additional Blood Point for each time the empowered blood hazard is activated in area B. The adjustments are not cumulative.

1-2 Blood Points Sezruth gains 10 temporary Hit Points.

3-4 Blood Points Sezruth gains 10 temporary Hit Points. Sezruth is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} and can use the extra action to Stride toward or Strike the foe it is aware of with the highest Charisma score.

5 or more Blood Points Sezruth gains 15 temporary Hit Points. Sezruth is quickened 1 and can use the extra action to Stride toward or Strike the foe it is aware of with the highest Charisma score
taMiq6FtqyhO2Kij.name: Empowered Blood

Sezruth (3-4).name: Sezruth (3-4)
Sezruth (3-4).npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

0XHcgxkgDqsXBxpu.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to Silaqui successfully hits her with a Strike.

Effect The attacker takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save) as they are battered by high-pressure water currents.
0XHcgxkgDqsXBxpu.name: Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom

0XHcgxkgDqsXBxpu.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to Silaqui successfully hits her with a Strike.

Effect The attacker takes @Damage[2d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save) as they are battered by high-pressure water currents.
0XHcgxkgDqsXBxpu.name: Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom

Sinkhole.description: An assortment of leaves and loose dirt cover a sudden drop in elevation.
Sinkhole.hazardDisable: @Check[nature|dc:12|name:Uncover Sinkhole|traits:environmental] to remove the covering foliage
Sinkhole.name: Sinkhole

6sY4dsXDk7ijJRT6.description: Half plate consists of most of the upper body plates used in full plate, with lighter or sparser steel plate protection for the arms and legs. This provides some of the protection of full plate with greater flexibility and speed. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor and a pair of gauntlets.
6sY4dsXDk7ijJRT6.name: Half Plate

IJWwhJN9hAWZSUST.description: The skeleton Strides and makes a claw Strike with a +4 circumstance bonus to damage circumstance bonus to damage. If the strike hits, the skeleton attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.nEwqNNWX6scLt4sc]{Demoralize: Intimidation} the target.
IJWwhJN9hAWZSUST.name: Terrifying Charge

b65tWh6PV9j81yq3.description:
This long bone functions as a Bo Staff.

This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It's designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.
b65tWh6PV9j81yq3.name: Long Bone

ywp4JyHQAVo3iLhj.description: When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released. Adjacent creatures take @Damage[2d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save
ywp4JyHQAVo3iLhj.name: Explosive Death

zZhXDr0O3nKNwMa4.description: The skeleton makes two Strikes with its bo staff against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.
zZhXDr0O3nKNwMa4.name: Broad Swipe

Sliding Statue (1-2).description: With a rumble, this statue of a former Pathfinder slides across the schoolyard. Its legs pump up and down as it advances.
Sliding Statue (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Hold Back Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] to hold it back, @Check[crafting|dc:17|name:Break Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to break the statue by exploiting a flaw, @Check[occultism|dc:16|name:Dispel Planar Energies|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to dispel the planar energies.
Sliding Statue (1-2).hazardRoutine: (3 actions) The trap uses its three actions for its Trample activity.
Sliding Statue (1-2).name: Sliding Statue (1-2)

Sliding Statue (3-4).description: With a rumble, this statue of a former Pathfinder slides across the schoolyard. Its legs pump up and down as it advances.
Sliding Statue (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:23|name:Hold Back Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] to hold it back, @Check[crafting|dc:20|name:Break Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to break the statue by exploiting a flaw, @Check[occultism|dc:18|name:Dispel Planar Energies|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to dispel the planar energies.
Sliding Statue (3-4).hazardRoutine: (3 actions) The trap uses its three actions for its Trample activity.
Sliding Statue (3-4).name: Sliding Statue (3-4)

6wqlMRJBrC4YDbIM.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Disease

HbaBlixSGEIgGNof.description: The opossum Strides up to half its speed. It can pass through other creatures' spaces during this movement, though it must end its movement in an unoccupied space.
HbaBlixSGEIgGNof.name: Scurry Underfoot

mGV6qaFmC4B3ur80.description:
Trigger The opossum is reduced below 15 HP

Effect The opossum collapses. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and can use actions that require only its mind, but any other action ends the ruse. A successful @Check[perception|dc:16|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:seek] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or @Check[medicine|dc:16|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:recall-knowledge] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} is required to determine that the animal is not, in fact, dead.
mGV6qaFmC4B3ur80.name: Feign Death

ygNOHtGxR72hMDBw.description:
Trigger The opossum is attacked or disturbed by a creature within reach while Feigning Death

Effect The opossum Strikes the triggering creature.
ygNOHtGxR72hMDBw.name: Revived Retaliation

Small Opossum.name: Small Opossum
Small Opossum.npcAllSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. disease

32sJ45kKGClodunO.description:
5 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save.

Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
32sJ45kKGClodunO.name: Smoldering Stench

5oauJ9Fciow42Wnn.description: Solvatar can Recall Knowledge on any subject with a +7 modifier.
5oauJ9Fciow42Wnn.name: Bardic Lore

6TNvLt8qd01lr9Zo.description:
You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you.

The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.

Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.
6TNvLt8qd01lr9Zo.name: Message

C7UhSAHB3m3n69JU.description:
You inspire yourself and your allies with words or tunes of encouragement. You and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.beReeFroAx24hj83]{Spell Effect: Courageous Anthem}
C7UhSAHB3m3n69JU.name: Inspire Courage

FK7Qdt1Vz0gAZKQY.description: Handheld instruments include bagpipes, a small set of chimes, small drums, fiddles and viols, flutes and recorders, small harps, lutes, trumpets, and similarly sized instruments. The GM might rule that an especially large handheld instrument (like a tuba) has greater Bulk. Heavy instruments such as large drums, a full set of chimes, and keyboard instruments are less portable and generally need to be stationary while played.
FK7Qdt1Vz0gAZKQY.name: Lute

HTaEXCd5yAEYeOZh.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).
HTaEXCd5yAEYeOZh.name: Detect Magic

IoGRHZw1QyVItEmQ.description:
Trigger You or an ally within 60 feet rolls a saving throw against an auditory or visual effect.

Your performance protects you and your allies. Roll a Performance check for a type you know: an auditory performance if the trigger was auditory, or a visual one for a visual trigger. You and allies in the area can use the better result between your Performance check and the saving throw.
IoGRHZw1QyVItEmQ.name: Counter Performance

MtUg72gygSdTWvCy.description:
You create an illusion that causes you to appear as another creature of the same body shape, and with roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds), as yourself. The disguise is typically good enough to hide your identity, but not to impersonate a specific individual. The spell doesn't change your voice, scent, or mannerisms. You can change the appearance of your clothing and worn items, such as making your armor look like a dress. Held items are unaffected, and any worn item you remove returns to its true appearance.

Casting illusory disguise counts as setting up a disguise for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.k5nW4jGyXD0Oq9LR]{Impersonate} use of Deception; it ignores any circumstance penalties you might take for disguising yourself as a dissimilar creature, it gives you a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through your disguise, and you add your level even if you're untrained. You can Dismiss this spell.

Heightened (2nd) The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

Heightened (3rd) You can appear as any creature of the same size, even a specific individual. You must have seen an individual to take on their appearance. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3Ktyd5F9lOPo4myk]{Spell Effect: Illusory Disguise}
MtUg72gygSdTWvCy.name: Illusory Disguise

On0bOJFzF1JD2963.description:
You forcibly calm creatures in the area, soothing them into a nonviolent state; each creature must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success Calming urges impose a -1 status penalty to the creature's attack rolls.

Failure Any emotion effects that would affect the creature are suppressed and the creature can't use hostile actions. If the target is subject to hostility from any other creature, it ceases to be affected by calm emotions.

Critical Failure As failure, but hostility doesn't end the effect.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Qr5rgoZvI4KmFY0N]{Spell Effect: Calm}
On0bOJFzF1JD2963.name: Calm Emotions

RRYYXP5WmuHMXxqB.description:
The simplest magic does your bidding. You can perform simple magical effects for as long as you Sustain the Spell. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can choose one of four options.

  • Cook Cool, warm, or flavor 1 pound of nonliving material.
  • Lift Slowly lift an unattended object of light Bulk or less 1 foot off the ground.
  • Make Create a temporary object of negligible Bulk, made of congealed magical substance. The object looks crude and artificial and is extremely fragile-it can't be used as a tool, weapon, or spell component.
  • Tidy Color, clean, or soil an object of light Bulk or less. You can affect an object of 1 Bulk with 10 rounds of concentration, and a larger object a 1 minute per Bulk.

Prestidigitation can't deal damage or cause adverse conditions. Any actual change to an object (beyond what is noted above) persists only as long as you Sustain the Spell.
RRYYXP5WmuHMXxqB.name: Prestidigitation

SPlegaQ5mgRnSjfg.description: You specify a trigger and a message up to 25 words long. When the specified trigger occurs within 30 feet of the target, an illusory mouth appears on the target and speaks the message, and the magic mouth spell ends.
SPlegaQ5mgRnSjfg.name: Magic Mouth

X6foIbBu3wX4NWOX.description:
You focus on the target object, opening your mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, you know whether that item is magical, and if it is, you learn the school of magic.

If the object is illusory, you detect this only if the effect's level is lower than the rank of your read aura spell.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to 10 objects.

Heightened (6th) You can target any number of objects.
X6foIbBu3wX4NWOX.name: Read Aura

yxhmSmGX71Xs5EV7.description:
You add a flourish to your composition to extend its benefits. If your next action is to cast a cantrip composition with a duration of 1 round, attempt a Performance check. The DC is usually a standard-difficulty DC of a level equal to the highest-level target of your composition, but the GM can assign a different DC based on the circumstances. The effect depends on the result of your check.

Critical Success The composition lasts 4 rounds.

Success The composition lasts 3 rounds.

Failure The composition lasts 1 round, but you don't spend the Focus Point for casting this spell.
yxhmSmGX71Xs5EV7.name: Lingering Composition

EOzNUSuV9na9Exal.description: The spark troll calls lightning down from the sky, then redirects it out from their hands in a @Template[line|distance:40]. Creatures in the line take @Damage[1d4[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save).
EOzNUSuV9na9Exal.name: Lightning Blast

R5zztXABMO2mtYBr.description:
Trigger The spark troll would take sonic damage

Effect The spark troll redirects hazardous sonic vibrations to another target within 30 feet. The spark troll gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, and their chosen target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:16] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
R5zztXABMO2mtYBr.name: Sonic Redirection

EOzNUSuV9na9Exal.description: The spark troll calls lightning down from the sky, then redirects it out from their hands in a @Template[line|distance:40]. Creatures in the line take @Damage[2d4[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).
EOzNUSuV9na9Exal.name: Lightning Blast

g1Zb6J7WyswNWBwe.description:
Trigger The spark troll would take sonic damage

Effect The spark troll redirects hazardous sonic vibrations to another target within 30 feet. The spark troll gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, and their chosen target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
g1Zb6J7WyswNWBwe.name: Sonic Redirection

8JUE6Z13hTUpIAbJ.description:
The tatzlwyrm belches a puff of frigid vapor into the face of an adjacent creature, which must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15|traits:damaging-effect] save; the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to this save if it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. The tatzlwyrm can't use Gelid Breath again for 2 rounds.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target takes @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage and is clumsy 1 for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[cold]] damage and is clumsy 1 for 1 minute.
8JUE6Z13hTUpIAbJ.name: Gelid Breath

idkdIpTpMENK2eFu.description: Ssalarn's white and blue scales provide natural camouflage. In areas of snow and ice, Ssalarn can move at his full Speed when Sneaking, and he gains a +4 circumstance bonus to Hide.
idkdIpTpMENK2eFu.name: Natural Camouflage

Hsh9yw0IW6kN2n8t.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature deals piercing or slashing damage to the sea drake

Effect An arc of electricity courses through the sea drake's blood. The triggering creature takes @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage.
Hsh9yw0IW6kN2n8t.name: Electrified Blood

gBFFibeJFk4MB72C.description: The sea drake makes one jaws Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.
gBFFibeJFk4MB72C.name: Draconic Frenzy

hTuKXeGWvUSUobx7.description:
The sea drake spews a ball of electricity that strikes a primary target within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[6d6[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save). The lightning then arcs to up to three secondary targets within 30 feet of the primary target, striking the closest available targets first. The secondary bolts each strike one secondary target and deal the same rolled damage value as the primary bolt (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

The sea drake can't use Ball Lightning Breath again for [[/br 1d6 #Recharge Ball Lightning Breath]]{1d6 rounds}.
hTuKXeGWvUSUobx7.name: Ball Lightning Breath

iWYCpNJjdadjk8JX.description:
A sea drake's saliva carries a large quantity of salt, making its bite wounds even more painful. When a creature takes damage from a sea drake's jaws Strike, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save; the creature is then temporarily immune to briny wound for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is Sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened.
iWYCpNJjdadjk8JX.name: Briny Wound

Sticky Web Lurker Noose.description: Discreet webbing at throat level snags a creature that walks into it.
Sticky Web Lurker Noose.name: Sticky Web Lurker Noose

Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).description: A ghostly host of god callers and their eidolons manifests to defend the barrow against intruders, and the strains of a battle song fill the air.
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[deception|dc:22] to appear to be a defender of Storasta, @Check[diplomacy|dc:22] to demonstrate benign intentions, or @Check[occultism|dc:20] or @Check[religion|dc:20] to ward off the malevolent spiritual energies. Two successful checks are required to disable the haunt, and each attempt requires two actions.
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).hazardReset: The haunt dissipates 1 minute after all living creatures leave area C1. Its spiritual energies re-form after 24 hours.
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).hazardRoutine: (1 action) (illusion, mental, occult) The haunt attacks what it believes is a demonic incursion, dealing @Damage[(1d8+3)[mental],1d8[good]]{1d8+3 mental and 1d8 good damage} to each living creature in the area (@Check[will|dc:21|basic|name:Storasta's Last Stand|traits:illusion,mental,occult] save).
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).name: Storasta's Last Stand (3-4)

Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).description: A ghostly host of god callers and their eidolons manifests to defend the barrow against intruders, and the strains of a battle song fill the air.
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[deception|dc:25] to appear to be a defender of Storasta, @Check[diplomacy|dc:25] to demonstrate benign intentions, or @Check[occultism|dc:22] or @Check[religion|dc:22] to ward off the malevolent spiritual energies. Two successful checks are required to disable the haunt, and each attempt requires two actions.
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).hazardReset: The haunt dissipates 1 minute after all living creatures leave area C1. Its spiritual energies re-form after 24 hours.
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).hazardRoutine: (1 action) (illusion, mental, occult) The haunt attacks what it believes is a demonic incursion, dealing @Damage[(1d8+9)[mental]] damage and @Damage[1d8[good]] damage to each living creature in the area (@Check[will|dc:24|basic|name:Storasta's Last Stand] save).
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).name: Storasta's Last Stand (5-6)

r8cgU9xUWcrYwZxc.description:
Trigger The storm bear is targeted by, or in the area of, an effect that deals electricity damage

Effect The storm bear devours some of the electricity to fuel a quick burst of speed, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. While quickened, the storm bear's motions produce visible sparks of electricity.
r8cgU9xUWcrYwZxc.name: Consume Lightning

rjEjl4EfYDSqvrBQ.description:
The storm bear unleashes a deafening roar. Any non-storm bear creature within 10 feet takes @Damage[2d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic] save); creatures that critically fail this save are deafened for [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}.

The storm bear can't use Thunderous Roar again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Thunderous Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.
rjEjl4EfYDSqvrBQ.name: Thunderous Roar

e3RlQHfH1zTKEKwf.description:
The storm bear unleashes a deafening roar. Any non-storm bear creature within 10 feet takes @Damage[2d10[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic] save); creatures that critically fail this save are deafened for [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}.

The storm bear can't use Thunderous Roar again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Thunderous Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.
e3RlQHfH1zTKEKwf.name: Thunderous Roar

qITipsKZASBgK8d2.description:
Trigger The storm bear is targeted by, or in the area of, an effect that deals electricity damage

Effect The storm bear devours some of the electricity to fuel a quick burst of speed, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. While quickened, the storm bear's motions produce visible sparks of electricity.
qITipsKZASBgK8d2.name: Consume Lightning

0huK4tVOXnDh73XE.description: A formula book holds the formulas necessary to make items other than the common equipment from this chapter; alchemists typically get one for free. Each formula book can hold the formulas for up to 100 different items. Formulas can also appear on parchment sheets, tablets, and almost any other medium; there's no need for you to copy them into a specific book as long as you can keep them on hand to reference them.
0huK4tVOXnDh73XE.name: Formula Book

7apC2gXmhz4Tuzd1.description:
Activate A Interact

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creatures natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain @Damage[(3d6+6)[healing]]{3d6+6 Hit Points} and gain +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.EpB7yJPEuG6ez4z3]{Effect: Elixir of Life (Lesser)}
7apC2gXmhz4Tuzd1.name: Elixir of Life (Lesser) [Infused]

7p1XussSqwcfWn2E.description:
Activate A Interact

With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

The radius of the burst is 20 feet.
7p1XussSqwcfWn2E.name: Smokestick (Greater) [Infused]

AAot6LC81mrQcnMK.description: Strak carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours, or until the next time he makes his daily preparations: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)} (9), and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ehss8yPTXxiUdVlJ]{Smokestick (Greater)}.
AAot6LC81mrQcnMK.name: Infused Items

RmqW1VU9CoScZ1B3.description: This mobile collection of vials and chemicals can be used for simple alchemical tasks.
RmqW1VU9CoScZ1B3.name: Alchemist's Tools

lBJ5WwwoCwV2xKTr.description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 2d8 fire damage, 2 persistent fire damage, and 2 fire splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.
lBJ5WwwoCwV2xKTr.name: Alchemist's Fire (Moderate) [Infused]

th6svLBMARDDgeA6.description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 2d6 persistent acid damage, and 2 acid splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.
th6svLBMARDDgeA6.name: Acid Flask (Moderate) [Infused]

v2jomqrygPJLCRjt.description: Strak draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.
v2jomqrygPJLCRjt.name: Quick Bomber

EBDp7Z31AQQfw3lY.description: Strak carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours, or until the next time he makes his daily preparations:@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)} (12), and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ehss8yPTXxiUdVlJ]{Smokestick (Greater)}.
EBDp7Z31AQQfw3lY.name: Infused Items

FnNegbkCY9FM9G7t.description:
Activate A Interact

With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

The radius of the burst is 20 feet.
FnNegbkCY9FM9G7t.name: Smokestick (Greater) [Infused]

GbQXwB1ase4PzDTF.description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 2d6 persistent acid damage, and 2 acid splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.
GbQXwB1ase4PzDTF.name: Acid Flask (Moderate) [Infused]

ZJYrWzyu8JwmD3n0.description: This mobile collection of vials and chemicals can be used for simple alchemical tasks.
ZJYrWzyu8JwmD3n0.name: Alchemist's Tools

feWTLG8uj4MemFWn.description:
Activate A Interact

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creatures natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain @Damage[(3d6+6)[healing]]{3d6+6 Hit Points} and gain +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.EpB7yJPEuG6ez4z3]{Effect: Elixir of Life (Lesser)}
feWTLG8uj4MemFWn.name: Elixir of Life (Lesser) [Infused]

mUcG86jRsgo9nOdm.description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 2d8 fire damage, 2 persistent fire damage, and 2 fire splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.
mUcG86jRsgo9nOdm.name: Alchemist's Fire (Moderate) [Infused]

mlzJ5auFszM10fBY.description: When throwing an alchemical bomb with the splash trait, Strak can treat the target's space as the first affected square of a @Template[cone|distance:15] directed away from him, potentially allowing him to avoid allies and splash deeper into enemy lines. If the target takes up more than a single square, the target's square closest to Strak is the first affected square of the cone.
mlzJ5auFszM10fBY.name: Directional Bombs

u5h7fJehOXTcIwtV.description: A formula book holds the formulas necessary to make items other than the common equipment from this chapter; alchemists typically get one for free. Each formula book can hold the formulas for up to 100 different items. Formulas can also appear on parchment sheets, tablets, and almost any other medium; there's no need for you to copy them into a specific book as long as you can keep them on hand to reference them.
u5h7fJehOXTcIwtV.name: Formula Book

zMvebelO9SzHUK7v.description: Strak draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.
zMvebelO9SzHUK7v.name: Quick Bomber

Stranded Melody (5-6).description: Planar winds summoned from beyond sweep through the room, song and sound carried adrift on their current. This air elemental is trapped on the Material Plane and can't escape.
Stranded Melody (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[performance|dc:24|name:Duplicate the Melody|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) twice to duplicate the melody and appease the elemental, or @Check[arcana|dc:27|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) and then @Check[diplomacy|dc:24|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) to guide the elemental through a planar tear elsewhere in the manor. Each attempt to Disable the hazard requires two actions, and each successful check to Disable removes one action from the hazard's routine.
Stranded Melody (5-6).hazardReset: The melody remains for 1 minute, after which it disperses into several holes in the walls. It returns after an hour unless disabled.
Stranded Melody (5-6).hazardRoutine: (2 actions) For each action in the routine, the melody makes a solid refrain Strike against one creature in its area. This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Stranded Melody (5-6).name: Stranded Melody (5-6)

Stranded Melody (7-8).description: Planar winds summoned from beyond sweep through the room, song and sound carried adrift on their current. This air elemental is trapped on the Material Plane and can't escape.
Stranded Melody (7-8).hazardDisable: @Check[performance|dc:27|name:Duplicate the Melody|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) twice to duplicate the melody and appease the elemental, or @Check[arcana|dc:30|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) and then @Check[diplomacy|dc:27|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) to guide the elemental through a planar tear elsewhere in the manor. Each attempt to Disable the hazard requires two actions, and each successful check to Disable removes one action from the hazard's routine.
Stranded Melody (7-8).hazardReset: The melody remains for 1 minute, after which it disperses into several holes in the walls. It returns after an hour unless disabled.
Stranded Melody (7-8).hazardRoutine: (2 actions) For each action in the routine, the melody makes a solid refrain Strike against one creature in its area. This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Stranded Melody (7-8).name: Stranded Melody (7-8)

71dIGYZunul6sXxT.description:
You channel void energy to harm the living or heal the undead. If the target is a living creature, you deal 1d8 void damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. If the target is a willing undead creature, you restore that amount of Hit Points. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing an undead creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.

3 (material, verbal, somatic) You disperse void energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the area.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.
71dIGYZunul6sXxT.name: Harm

8KeQ5vAR6awbPvR9.description:
You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.
8KeQ5vAR6awbPvR9.name: Daze

ASu3qmJKE5NpxnUO.description:
Siphoning void energy into yourself, your hand radiates a pale darkness. Your touch weakens the living and disorients undead, possibly even causing them to flee. The effect depends on whether the target is living or undead.

  • Living Creature The spell deals void damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting modifier. The target attempts a basic Fortitude save, but is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round on a critical failure.
  • Undead Creature The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round on a failed Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Will save.

Heightened (+1) The void damage to living creatures increases by 1d4.
ASu3qmJKE5NpxnUO.name: Chill Touch

AfEFDaf9A7uSHKS6.description: Providing the same defensive function as a standard gauntlet, this version has a group of spikes protruding from the knuckles to deliver piercing damage with a punch.
AfEFDaf9A7uSHKS6.name: Spiked Gauntlet

LHJasYB4J1jhasfs.description:
Illusory pain wracks the target, dealing 2d4 mental damage and 1d4 persistent mental damage. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes full initial damage but no persistent damage, and the spell ends immediately.

Failure The target takes full initial and persistent damage, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. If the target recovers from being Sickened, the persistent damage ends and the spell ends.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d4 and the persistent damage by 1d4.

@Damage[(@item.level)d4[persistent,mental]]{Leveled Persistent Mental Damage}
LHJasYB4J1jhasfs.name: Phantom Pain

N5GFsVk17rh8tJ0V.description:
A ray that saps a foe's strength flashes from your hand. Attempt a ranged spell attack against the target. If you succeed, that creature attempts a Fortitude save to determine the spell's effect. If your attack roll is a critical success, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of its save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}.

Critical Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}.
N5GFsVk17rh8tJ0V.name: Ray of Enfeeblement

QIe6a9K01HggJnti.description:
You shout a command that's hard to ignore. You can command the target to approach you, run away (as if it had the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition), release what it's holding, drop @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, or stand in place. It can't Delay or take any reactions until it has obeyed your command. The effects depend on the target's Will save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to do as you command.

Critical Failure The target must use all its actions on its next turn to obey your command.

Heightened (5th) You can target up to 10 creatures.
QIe6a9K01HggJnti.name: Command

cBTG37mFOpldni0d.description:
In your mind's eye, you see a path northward. You immediately know which direction is north (if it exists at your current location).

Heightened (7th) You can instead know the direction to a familiar location, such as a previous home or a favorite tavern.
cBTG37mFOpldni0d.name: Know Direction

gn7y1zWFjaK7NGgE.description:
You inflict pain upon the target and revel in their anguish. This deals 1d4 mental damage and [[/r (@item.level)d4[persistent,mental]]] damage; the target must attempt a Will save. As long as the target is taking persistent damage from this spell, you gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and skill checks against the target.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage and no Persistent Damage.

Failure The target takes full initial and Persistent Damage.

Critical Failure The target takes double initial and Persistent Damage.

Heightened (+1) The initial damage increases by 1d4 and the Persistent Damage increases by 1d4.
gn7y1zWFjaK7NGgE.name: Savor the Sting

oAqUayimlzZFsEF0.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
oAqUayimlzZFsEF0.name: Religious Symbol of Zon-Kuthon (Wooden)

vPqK0Xzj05Is8zqq.description:
Requirements Teflar has spent at least 1 Focus Point

Trigger Teflar takes bleed, piercing, or slashing damage

Effect Teflar regains 1 Focus Point
vPqK0Xzj05Is8zqq.name: Invigorating Agony

yF3ufM63gGXkHK5x.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.
yF3ufM63gGXkHK5x.name: Shield

K9DEiC1oIoqDWUwg.description:
Tewakam points out a weakness of a creature within 30 feet. Tewakam and all allies that can hear or see him gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls against that creature until the beginning of Tewakam's next turn. Tewakam adds an extra 1d4 precision damage to his weapon and unarmed attacks that hit that creature during the duration.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uqjx1bwYduHwwC7d]{Effect: Guiding Words}
K9DEiC1oIoqDWUwg.name: Guiding Words

cyw0PQ9OsauAO56c.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded", having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.
cyw0PQ9OsauAO56c.name: Greataxe

ggo8dEkNuvsu7eRM.description:
Trigger Tewakam is about to roll a Perception or Survival check to determine his initiative

Effect Tewakam visually or audibly warns allies, granting them a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls. Depending on how Tewakam warns allies, this action has the auditory or visual trait.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.UiISDbCjK6AUDsll]{Effect: Guide's Warning}
ggo8dEkNuvsu7eRM.name: Guide's Warning

qPTwvxQv1mo9ajtw.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded", having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.
qPTwvxQv1mo9ajtw.name: Greataxe

Tewakam and all allies that can hear or see him gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls against that creature until the beginning of Tewakam's next turn. Tewakam adds an extra 1d6 precision damage to his weapon and unarmed attacks that hit that creature during the duration.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uqjx1bwYduHwwC7d]{Effect: Guiding Words}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.UiISDbCjK6AUDsll]{Effect: Guide's Warning}
tsRGi8NhAkK2WlCO.name: Guide's Warning

1JLdh4qC2VvLZieO.description: On the first round of combat, if the saboteur rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to them.
1JLdh4qC2VvLZieO.name: Surprise Attack

CE6qvmo0zUHT641d.description:
Trigger An ally ends a move action adjacent to Sythi.

Effect Sythi hides behind his ally. He Steps to another square adjacent to the triggering ally and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to his AC against the next attack that targets him. (Sythi only.)
CE6qvmo0zUHT641d.name: Sythi: Nervous Retreat

Fi9w21xip3Dxsry6.description: Rahla's scalpel is coated with a disorienting agent. The first creature she successfully hits with a scalpel strike must succeed on a @Check[fortitude|dc:22|traits:poison] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}; this is a poison effect. (Rahla only.)
Fi9w21xip3Dxsry6.name: Rahla: Applied Anesthesia

Hrf4HbW0m1p6hHhY.description: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."
Hrf4HbW0m1p6hHhY.name: Shark Commune 150 feet

S5lcA3GKpd5I8WDA.description: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals @Damage[1d4[bleed]] if the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or if the attack was a critical hit.
S5lcA3GKpd5I8WDA.name: Bloodletting

V725DltsiUGNUBXs.description: Odru's faith extends her wavesense to a range of 60 feet and allows it to function equally well in clouds of water droplets or vapor, such as mist. (Odru only.)
V725DltsiUGNUBXs.name: Odru: Wind and Wavesense

XMiYQ1aVbQrOIbnS.description: The saboteur deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
XMiYQ1aVbQrOIbnS.name: Sneak Attack

cZMrsm8iHJmQlhLf.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.
cZMrsm8iHJmQlhLf.name: Scalpel

wZTyTWJia1mgnQH1.description:
Requirements The sea devil is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 15 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.
wZTyTWJia1mgnQH1.name: Blood Frenzy

5mEQuzEua8VM5vjF.description:
Requirements The sea devil is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 15 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.
5mEQuzEua8VM5vjF.name: Blood Frenzy

QvMX0E3ZQln2Bb1I.description: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."
QvMX0E3ZQln2Bb1I.name: Shark Commune 150 feet

SI3JMojfD5PRH3ne.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.
SI3JMojfD5PRH3ne.name: +1 Striking Scalpel

TOOcJmFQzc4oXTpe.description: Odru's faith extends her wavesense to a range of 60 feet and allows it to function equally well in clouds of water droplets or vapor, such as mist. (Odru only.)
TOOcJmFQzc4oXTpe.name: Odru: Wind and Wavesense

ZD2utUKEeYWYhfjw.description: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals @Damage[1d4[bleed]] if the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or if the attack was a critical hit.
ZD2utUKEeYWYhfjw.name: Bloodletting

Trigger An ally ends a move action adjacent to Sythi.

Effect Sythi hides behind his ally. He Steps to another square adjacent to the triggering ally and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to his AC against the next attack that targets him. (Sythi only.)
c0Rop5BsChQwTXjP.name: Sythi: Nervous Retreat

f2tBEfQluaaEyFuM.description: On the first round of combat, if the saboteur rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to them.
f2tBEfQluaaEyFuM.name: Surprise Attack

mqsb9fOkcaNyASnJ.description: The saboteur deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
mqsb9fOkcaNyASnJ.name: Sneak Attack

tG7YbIQ0JzByE7yL.description: Rahla's scalpel is coated with a disorienting agent. The first creature she successfully hits with a scalpel strike must succeed on a @Check[fortitude|dc:24|traits:poison] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}; this is a poison effect. (Rahla only.)
tG7YbIQ0JzByE7yL.name: Rahla: Applied Anesthesia

The Scholar of Sorts (1-2).description:
Akizendris gnaw at sources of knowledge and lore, gleefully corrupting and altering them to vex scholars and sages across the planes with contradictions and untruths. These proteans appear as cackling, serpentine creatures with elongated crocodilian faces, luminous eyes, and arms that vanish at the elbows into swirling clouds of runes before reforming into solid talons.

Akizendris amuse themselves by rearranging or deleting texts, placing insulting acrostics in poetic verses, and penning crude insults upon title pages. Libraries in such places as Heaven, Axis, and Hell are especially keen to avoid such contamination, knowing that their records are choice targets for every akizendri in existence.

3WqEPpUcLFd5pJv6.description:
An akizendri's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the Scholar takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The Scholar is immune to polymorph effects unless they are a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the Scholar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.
3WqEPpUcLFd5pJv6.name: Protean Anatomy 6

AqnqPdAeJ4TadZfy.description:
You craft a trap by binding a hostile spell into a symbol. While Casting this Spell, you also Cast a Spell of a lower spell rank to store in the glyph. The stored spell must take 3 actions or fewer to cast, have a hostile effect, and target one creature or have an area. You can set a password, a trigger, or both for the glyph. Any creature that moves, opens, or touches the target container or enters the target area that doesn't speak the password or that matches the trigger activates the glyph, releasing the harmful spell within.

Once a spell is stored in the glyph, the glyph gains all the traits of that spell. If the stored spell targets one or more creatures, it targets the creature that set off the glyph. If it has an area, that area is centered on the creature that set off the glyph. Glyph of warding's duration ends when the glyph is triggered. The glyph counts as a magical trap, using your spell DC for both the Perception check to notice it and the Thievery check to disable it; both checks require the creature attempting them to be trained in order to succeed.

You can Dismiss glyph of warding. The maximum number of glyphs of warding you can have active at a time is equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.
AqnqPdAeJ4TadZfy.name: Glyph of Warding

DI7YzBJOCOpW0OHx.description:
You create a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because you're levitating the object, you can move it in any direction. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

Heightened (3rd) You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (7th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
DI7YzBJOCOpW0OHx.name: Mage Hand

JnEeLEMrdvixo1Jb.description:
Your eyes glow as you sense aligned auras. Choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful. You detect auras of that alignment. You receive no information beyond presence or absence. You can choose not to detect creatures or effects you're aware have that alignment.

Only creatures of 6th level or higher-unless divine spellcasters, undead, or beings from the Outer Sphere-have alignment auras.

Heightened (2nd) You learn each aura's location and strength.
JnEeLEMrdvixo1Jb.name: Detect Alignment (At will) (Lawful only)

OJm7rYI5Ruon3nTT.description:
Requirements The Scholar is adjacent to a text they have modified with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VVAZPCvd4d90qVA1]{Secret Page}, and another such text is within 500 feet

Effect The Scholar has a way with words beyond other akizendris. They physically immerse themself into the adjacent text, which they use as a medium to teleport to another text within 500 feet that they have modified with secret page. Once they enter the first text, they instantly know the locations of the other texts within range.

Entering a text in this manner automatically dispels the secret page effect on it, but not the secret page effect on the destination text. The locations of the Scholar's modified texts are marked on the map.
OJm7rYI5Ruon3nTT.name: Text Passage

iVSgSU6j50pLkB5h.description: You repel effects that would hinder a creature or slow its movement. While under this spell's effect, the target ignores effects that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} an effect that has them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, they automatically succeed unless the effect is magical and of a higher level than the freedom of movement spell.
iVSgSU6j50pLkB5h.name: Freedom of Movement (Constant)

nIDe1OaPgWDPyBej.description:
When the Scholar casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VVAZPCvd4d90qVA1]{Secret Page}, it can physically immerse itself in the text, changing the message of the text in the process. It can exit the book at any point by Dismissing secret page, at which point it appears in a space adjacent to the text. If it does so to begin combat, it rolls a Deception check for initiative.

As long as it remains immersed in the text, the Scholar has no body. It can communicate telepathically with a creature as long as the creature touches the book or scroll that contains the secret page. It can sense nearby creatures using its entropy sense, but not in any other way, nor can it use any attack, manipulate, or move actions or speak aloud. If the object they are immersed in is destroyed, the Scholar reappears in an adjacent square and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.
nIDe1OaPgWDPyBej.name: Text Immersion

rB0kJuC158tvKsmj.description:

rB0kJuC158tvKsmj.name: Garbled Thoughts

If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

xPpMQTchE30E4UpO.name: Daze

The Scholar of Sorts (1-2).name: The Scholar of Sorts (1-2)

The Scholar of Sorts (3-4).description:
Akizendris gnaw at sources of knowledge and lore, gleefully corrupting and altering them to vex scholars and sages across the planes with contradictions and untruths. These proteans appear as cackling, serpentine creatures with elongated crocodilian faces, luminous eyes, and arms that vanish at the elbows into swirling clouds of runes before reforming into solid talons.

Akizendris amuse themselves by rearranging or deleting texts, placing insulting acrostics in poetic verses, and penning crude insults upon title pages. Libraries in such places as Heaven, Axis, and Hell are especially keen to avoid such contamination, knowing that their records are choice targets for every akizendri in existence.

3Hm2zIWqx6Z2Qsvp.description:
You craft a trap by binding a hostile spell into a symbol. While Casting this Spell, you also Cast a Spell of a lower spell rank to store in the glyph. The stored spell must take 3 actions or fewer to cast, have a hostile effect, and target one creature or have an area. You can set a password, a trigger, or both for the glyph. Any creature that moves, opens, or touches the target container or enters the target area that doesn't speak the password or that matches the trigger activates the glyph, releasing the harmful spell within.

Once a spell is stored in the glyph, the glyph gains all the traits of that spell. If the stored spell targets one or more creatures, it targets the creature that set off the glyph. If it has an area, that area is centered on the creature that set off the glyph. Glyph of warding's duration ends when the glyph is triggered. The glyph counts as a magical trap, using your spell DC for both the Perception check to notice it and the Thievery check to disable it; both checks require the creature attempting them to be trained in order to succeed.

You can Dismiss glyph of warding. The maximum number of glyphs of warding you can have active at a time is equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.
3Hm2zIWqx6Z2Qsvp.name: Glyph of Warding

3WqEPpUcLFd5pJv6.description:
An akizendri's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the Scholar takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The Scholar is immune to polymorph effects unless they are a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the Scholar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.
3WqEPpUcLFd5pJv6.name: Protean Anatomy 8

5KAkGKvo8frLyOhr.description:
You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.
5KAkGKvo8frLyOhr.name: Daze

BzT5Azcx9OnlAnpT.description:
You create a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because you're levitating the object, you can move it in any direction. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

Heightened (3rd) You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (7th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
BzT5Azcx9OnlAnpT.name: Mage Hand

Effect The Scholar has a way with words beyond other akizendris. They physically immerse themself into the adjacent text, which they use as a medium to teleport to another text within 500 feet that they have modified with secret page. Once they enter the first text, they instantly know the locations of the other texts within range.

Entering a text in this manner automatically dispels the secret page effect on it, but not the secret page effect on the destination text. The locations of the Scholar's modified texts are marked on the map.
OJm7rYI5Ruon3nTT.name: Text Passage

QHLhcGE9S7zRFSX1.description:
Your eyes glow as you sense aligned auras. Choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful. You detect auras of that alignment. You receive no information beyond presence or absence. You can choose not to detect creatures or effects you're aware have that alignment.

Only creatures of 6th level or higher-unless divine spellcasters, undead, or beings from the Outer Sphere-have alignment auras.

Heightened (2nd) You learn each aura's location and strength.
QHLhcGE9S7zRFSX1.name: Detect Alignment (At will) (Lawful only)

j3ELc14hlrOyqOK9.description:
Trigger The leaded skeleton is hit by a melee attack

Effect A cloud of lead dust is released, forming a @Template[burst|distance:5]{5-foot radius} cloud of fine particles surrounding the skeleton. The cloud persists for 1 round, exposing creatures within it to an inhaled form of rapid lead poison.
j3ELc14hlrOyqOK9.name: Lead Cloud

mTwyXddJq3vxuscO.description:
High amounts of lead can cause headache, difficulty concentrating, and joint pain. Necromantic magic has augmented the lead that infuses this skeleton, causing it to take effect far more quickly than is typical for lead poisoning.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage,@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, stupefied 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (2 rounds)
mTwyXddJq3vxuscO.name: Rapid Lead Poison

HbaBlixSGEIgGNof.name: Scurry Underfoot

mGV6qaFmC4B3ur80.description:
Trigger The opossum is reduced below 15 HP

Effect The opossum collapses. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and can use actions that require only its mind, but any other action ends the ruse. A successful @Check[perception|dc:18|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:seek] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or @Check[medicine|dc:18|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:recall-knowledge] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} is required to determine that the animal is not, in fact, dead.
mGV6qaFmC4B3ur80.name: Feign Death

ygNOHtGxR72hMDBw.description:
Trigger The opossum is attacked or disturbed by a creature within reach while Feigning Death

Effect The opossum Strikes the triggering creature.
ygNOHtGxR72hMDBw.name: Revived Retaliation

Tough Small Opossum.name: Tough Small Opossum
Tough Small Opossum.npcAllSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. disease

Twigjack (PFS 2-08).description:
Maladjusted forest denizens, twigjacks form from the cruel and prankish combination of fey and the very woods in which they reside. A twigjack's body is made up of prickly brambles woven with vines. Shaggy, mossy growth, not unlike hair, tops a twigjack's head. Its mouth is just a canyon of splintered and broken sticks bisecting its face. Leaves and sprigs of new growth randomly sprout from the creature's body. Many dense forests on Golarion have at least a handful of twigjacks living in the undergrowth.

While truculent and violent, twigjacks care deeply for what they consider to be their forests. These creatures harass outsiders who delve deep into their wooded domains, forcing back even the most determined explorers, foresters, and travelers, especially when those intruders cut roads through the forest. However, they are not terribly territorial when it comes to other forest creatures. When sylvan creatures, especially fey, rally against an outside threat, twigjacks in the area eagerly arrive to fight, even if they were not invited.

Less seasoned travelers who encounter twigjacks in their canopied homes often mistake them for leshys, a tendency that frustrates twigjacks, as they have a low opinion of such creatures. More broadly, twigjacks resent being considered mere animated plants at all. Rather, they embrace their fey heritage-often to a foolish end. Twigjacks go out of their way to ingratiate themselves to the fey creatures they live among. Several popular comic songs weave the tale of a twigjack attempting to woo a powerful and graceful dryad, only to be comically disgraced after many loutish attempts. Many fey seem embarrassed by these strange cousins, but some spriggans, quicklings, and redcaps harness the twigjacks' violent urges and disruptive behavior for their own purposes.

While twigjacks are fey, and as such are often found in the First World, it's somewhat curious that those twigjacks who find religion only rarely turn to the Eldest of the First World. Instead, twigjacks tend to worship false deities of their own design: figures spotted in tangles of tree branches, clots of undergrowth, or other hidden nooks in the natural world. These religions are always highly localized, and while these faiths do not support clerics, they often inspire zealous crusades against non-fey.

dOcDYCNGkTD6GGcZ.description:
The twigjack sprays a barrage of splinters and brambles from its body in a @Template[cone|distance:15], dealing @Damage[4d6[piercing]] damage(@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

It can't use Splinter Spray again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Splinter Spray]]{1d4 rounds}.
dOcDYCNGkTD6GGcZ.name: Splinter Spray

Twigjack (PFS 2-08).name: Twigjack (PFS 2-08)

Unkillable Zombie Shambler.description:
A zombie shambler is a slow-moving horror dangerous in larger groups.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

eulyI60JHNUYs39w.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
eulyI60JHNUYs39w.name: Slow

v90WRjELLiKF57vr.description: Requirements The zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.
v90WRjELLiKF57vr.name: Jaws

Unkillable Zombie Shambler.name: Unkillable Zombie Shambler

Unstable Ice.name: Unstable Ice

BRm0ceL6QtFGoGFC.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).
BRm0ceL6QtFGoGFC.name: Detect Magic

CO1CMVfrN9ixp9wX.description:
You fill the minds of your enemies with doubt.

Enemies in the area must succeed at a Will save or take a -1 status penalty to attack rolls as long as they are in the area.

Once per turn, starting the turn after you cast bane, you can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet and force enemies in the area that weren't yet affected to attempt another saving throw.

Bane can counteract bless.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.UTLp7omqsiC36bso]{Spell Effect: Bane}
CO1CMVfrN9ixp9wX.name: Bane

EFFO9nrXCjacAmju.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
EFFO9nrXCjacAmju.name: Religious Symbol of Ahriman (Wooden)

XbTD7oBK1dYTt4M9.description:
Trigger The Usij acolyte is reduced to 0 Hit Points, and the acolyte can see or hear a div within 60 feet

Effect The Usij Acolyte makes a melee Strike before dying.
XbTD7oBK1dYTt4M9.name: Death Frenzy

f7wC2FMTW7kM5gih.description:
You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.
f7wC2FMTW7kM5gih.name: Daze

gWNPW5FIiFvtbnvE.description:
You ask for divine guidance, granting the target a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check the target attempts before the duration ends. The target chooses which roll to use the bonus on before rolling. If the target uses the bonus, the spell ends. Either way, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3qHKBDF7lrHw8jFK]{Spell Effect: Guidance}
gWNPW5FIiFvtbnvE.name: Guidance

463ekA24x3uJx5BX.description:
You channel vitality energy to heal the living or damage the undead. If the target is a willing living creature, you restore 1d8 Hit Points. If the target is undead, you deal that amount of vitality damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing a living creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8

3 (material, somatic, verbal) You disperse vitality energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the burst.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.
463ekA24x3uJx5BX.name: Heal

BRm0ceL6QtFGoGFC.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).
BRm0ceL6QtFGoGFC.name: Detect Magic

CO1CMVfrN9ixp9wX.description:
You fill the minds of your enemies with doubt.

Enemies in the area must succeed at a Will save or take a -1 status penalty to attack rolls as long as they are in the area.

Once per turn, starting the turn after you cast bane, you can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet and force enemies in the area that weren't yet affected to attempt another saving throw.

Bane can counteract bless.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.UTLp7omqsiC36bso]{Spell Effect: Bane}
CO1CMVfrN9ixp9wX.name: Bane

XbTD7oBK1dYTt4M9.description:
Trigger The Usij cultist is reduced to 0 Hit Points, and the cultist can see or hear a div within 60 feet

Effect The Usij cultist makes a melee Strike before dying.
XbTD7oBK1dYTt4M9.name: Death Frenzy

ZwbkadYXMIJKtPyz.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
ZwbkadYXMIJKtPyz.name: Religious Symbol of Ahriman (Wooden)

f7wC2FMTW7kM5gih.description:
You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.
f7wC2FMTW7kM5gih.name: Daze

gCPFA6aPxxzAhXMl.description:
You channel void energy to harm the living or heal the undead. If the target is a living creature, you deal 1d8 void damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. If the target is a willing undead creature, you restore that amount of Hit Points. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing an undead creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.

3 (material, verbal, somatic) You disperse void energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the area.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.
gCPFA6aPxxzAhXMl.name: Harm

You ask for divine guidance, granting the target a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check the target attempts before the duration ends. The target chooses which roll to use the bonus on before rolling. If the target uses the bonus, the spell ends. Either way, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3qHKBDF7lrHw8jFK]{Spell Effect: Guidance}
gWNPW5FIiFvtbnvE.name: Guidance

rLXQzXAjcjalCtgb.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.
rLXQzXAjcjalCtgb.name: Shield

MzG41UtPoUR97Agr.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Valgomorus is about to roll a d20

Effect The cyclops peers into an occluded spectrum of possible futures. He gets a success (but not a critical success) on the roll instead of rolling.
MzG41UtPoUR97Agr.name: Flash of Insight

Z7w9qFdE3oh67V3D.description: Valgomorus makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A counts as two attacks for Valgomorus's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.
Z7w9qFdE3oh67V3D.name: Swipe

gW7FWlbRJEMvMTF1.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded", having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.
gW7FWlbRJEMvMTF1.name: Greataxe

oqTdJ8GgyPpxj0Gs.description:
When Valgomorus damages a living creature with his claw Strike, he gains 3 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Further successful claw Strikes increase the drained value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.
oqTdJ8GgyPpxj0Gs.name: Drain Life

2webGMKTaL6lqCD7.description:
A living humanoid slain by Valgomorus's claw Strike rises as a spawned wight after [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawned wight is under the command of the wight that killed it (in this case, Valgomorus). It doesn't have drain life or wight spawn and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as it is a spawned wight.

If the creator of the spawned wight dies, the spawned wight becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains drain life and wight spawn, and is no longer clumsy.
2webGMKTaL6lqCD7.name: Wight Spawn

ZGaQjs8d0aeyJrg7.description:
When Valgomorus damages a living creature with his claw Strike, he gains 3 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Further successful claw Strikes increase the drained value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.
ZGaQjs8d0aeyJrg7.name: Drain Life

cf7ANCTMyOtyXFkW.description: Valgomorus makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within his melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A counts as two attacks for the multiple attack penalty, though the penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.
cf7ANCTMyOtyXFkW.name: Swipe

Frequency once per day

Trigger Valgomorus is about to roll a d20

Effect Valgomorus peers into an occluded spectrum of possible futures. He gets a success (but not a critical success) on the roll instead of rolling.
